Positive Reviews:
Exceptional location. Right at a busy square called oktogon square. Easy access to Public transport system like Tram, Buses, Metro and taxis all the time.
Breakfast is good enought to start your day with coffee, boiled eggs, cereals, breads and spreads.

Negative Reviews: The airconditioning in the rooms didn't work so it was super hot at night during the summer heatwave in Budapest.
Positive Reviews: The free breakfast and the cleanliness of the place was great! The kitchen was also very good and held clean. The common areas where also nice and the staff was nice.

Review Title: Great value for money, wonderful location.
Negative Reviews:
Rooms were tidy, but the combined shower/toilet on my floor was a little tight. If possible it would have been better if they were separated, seeing as we were several guests on that floor sharing those facilities. 

I was also unsure of the sheets. Even though it was nice to come to a made bed, I think I would prefer to get sheets from the reception so I as a guest can really feel that they are newly washed. I had no reason to question it, but I just prefer it generally.
Positive Reviews: Super central, easy to get around and the overall impression was really nice. It’s a shame the courtyard is not what it looked like on the pictures; if there were like an inside garden with the possibility to sit outside and have drinks, that would for sure be give extra points!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Positive Reviews: Central to the city, cool party vibe.
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Positive Reviews: Good location, staff are excellent.marel, Matteo vyom all always helpful
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: A/C was not working during the duration of my stay. If it was, this probably would've been the best hostel I stayed at during my Europe trip.
My room was facing the square and we opened it due to a many people being in the dorm, so it was a bit louder at night.
Positive Reviews: The hostel is located ideally in the Octagon Square in Pest, so it is easy to reach every destination in Budapest, even by foot. Hostel staff was nice and beds were totally fine, also lots of space in the rooms and the hostel overall, also comes with free breakfast! I didn't use the options for meeting up with people, but I can imagine it is an ideal hostel for finding travel partners as well.

Kumar Amrendra held a guide tour for me and a few other travelers. The tour was super nice for a first-timer who wants to get to know the most important things about Budapest and have a fun time; he breathes puns like it is air.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: Very noisy at night, music was playing loudly at 1 am at the common area which was next to my room
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, helpful staff, free walking tours (thanks to Kumar who made a great walking tour around the city), space to socialise and make new friends

Review Title: A great location within the city
Negative Reviews: The room that I stayed in on the third floor has 8 beds and they are connected right next to one another. This made it difficult when someone was rocking their bed constantly and then when they make loud noise in their sleep too. I’m not sure what happened from the time that I initially arrived the room felt climate controlled but later within the week it became much more warm. Unfortunately a small group visiting to attend a music festival on a daily basis would serve themselves alcoholic drinks and play their music loudly in the kitchen area on the third floor. Knowing that this was happening it would had been thoughtful for someone from the reception desk to make the group aware that the environment on the third floor is space being used by other guests too not just their group. Their isn’t a dedicated quiet place to study or work so it leaves a person to have to decide on which common area between the three floors is most suitable for them to use.
Positive Reviews: Each designated kitchen area is well organized and meets many needs for what you could need when preparing a meal. The bathrooms are adequate. The cleaning staff does a detailed work to keep areas throughout the hostel immaculate and the staff that each morning prepares a light breakfast for the guests are very accommodating for the hostel as well. Where the hostel is located at Oktogon nearby a tram is convenient for getting around the city.

Negative Reviews:
Breakfast is really simple. Toast, jam, butter, cucumber, tomato, paprika, egg(hard to peel off), milk, oatmeal, tea
There is some yellow stain on the bedsheet. The quilt smells nice.
Positive Reviews:
The lobby has AC. Four-people room has AC. It is really cool. Two rooms share two bathroom. We also have our private kitchen. (microwave, toaster, kettle and induction stove) It is really nice. (8 people-room do not have AC)
You can use the locker to store your luggage. It is safer. The luggage room does not have a door. You might be careful whether someone stole it.
The staff cleans the table often and refill the food regularly. They provide enough papers on each table.
It has a lift.
The location is super nice and convenient!!!!!!!!
They provide hair dryer in the bathroom. Nice.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: Location is still quite a walk (15-20 minutes) to the bars and to the river. The hostel is HUGE, but honestly no real complaints!
Positive Reviews: Super clean, central location next to the tram. Free breakfast is nice, and the staff is professional! The boat party is awesome too. Just comfortable, definitely glad I stayed here!

Negative Reviews: Nothing to mention, really!
Positive Reviews: As always, everything but the neighbours. :)

Review Title: I loved this place. Everything was not a problem.
Negative Reviews: Well, I really can't think of anything!
Positive Reviews:
The building was old, but clean, tidy, organised, and my dorm room was great! The site was in the middle of all the traffic and action, but it was very quiet and peaceful inside the rooms. Staff were very friendly and very helpful.
Breakfast was included. Lots of good food to keep me going for a few hours out and about.
The kitchen dishes system worked well and was well supervised. Because everyone was doing their bit, everyone benefitted.
Buying an evening meal was an easy option if one wanted to take advantage of it, but there was also a perfectly good, quiet mini kitchen next to my dorm, with everything one would need to whip up some small meal, or stay up late quietly planning the next day, without disturbing anyone.
Organised evening entertainment and fun things to do was a great feature. 
Having a light and spacious lounge area in the middle of everything was lovely. It made the place welcoming and very much less lonely.
This was a great introduction to my first adventure as a solo traveller in a foreign country.
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews:
The bathrooms are not separated and we had only 2/floor. I think it's too little, especially for crowded hours. 
There is no AC and the fans were broken. Only 2 were working in my room and a guy took them both, for 2 days
Positive Reviews: The bed was comfortable and I liked the curtains - it gave a sense of privacy and it helped with light from other roommates. The breakfast was fair.

Negative Reviews: Breakfast, it was just a few options.
Positive Reviews: Great location, good price.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Positive Reviews: It was clean and good value. Showers and the toilet were also clean and the staff is really nice.
Good as always. Third time there
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: Too much noise but lucklily we were on a corner room.
Positive Reviews: Walking tour with kumar was really interesting and location was great.

Negative Reviews: The room was too warm and very small
Positive Reviews: Breakfast is included! and there is always something going on in the hostel! Great location as well, it is in one of the main streets leading to the Danube river!

Negative Reviews: Very busy. I feel like it’s a bit of a party hostel so most of the people in my room didn’t understand quiet hours (talking and loudly being on the phone at 1 and 7 am for example).
Positive Reviews: Great location, free breakfast and they also organise a lot of activities.

Negative Reviews: NA
Positive Reviews: Convenient location.Reception Mateo & Erjka are helpful.
Room Type: Bed in 4-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Excellent place Great staff and excellent service
Negative Reviews: But I didn't like the noise, maybe for too many guests, and I won't repeat the visit.
Positive Reviews: A very great place and till the workers were nice and the whole crew was excellent

Review Title: Everything you need in one place.
Negative Reviews: Slow laundry service and it seems like the clothes wasn’t properly washed when I got them back.
Positive Reviews: Central location and modern facilities. I decided to join a walking tour arranged by the hostel, and got to se a lot of the city in three hours. Our guide Kumar Amrendra showed a wide range of interesting facts about the history and monuments in Budapest.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room

Review Title: It was super sociable and had great facilities considering the price. Would Recommend!
Positive Reviews: The reception was extremely helpful in advising me on things to do around Budapest which was a huge help! The lady I worked with most was Maral, and she was absolutely great! We also did a walking tour with a guide named Kumar Amrendra. He was a great guide that took us to the major scenes in Budapest and gave a great history of Hungary and Budapest itself.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Fantastic! Very glad I chose this hostel
Negative Reviews: The free included breakfast was lackluster, but I guess it's ok if you're starving in the morning. Definitely not bad - didn't make me sick and it was a nice comfort to have, but I ended up eating out both because Budapest is cheap and because there wasn't really much to the breakfast.
Positive Reviews:
It was brilliant! The friendliest staff, very social experience around the hostel, even though I'm quite a big person the bed was spacious (8 person capsule room). Very much recommend and would definitely come there at F1 time next year!
Also considering it was summertime the room was ventilated well enough that heat didn't feel like a problem when going to sleep which I was afraid it might be.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: One of better choices in Budapest
Negative Reviews: Breakfast is the same every day. The pillow is too small. Bunk bed ladder is awful - the steps just hurt feet every time
Positive Reviews: That hostel is a very good choice. Excellent wifi, comfortable beds with privacy blankets. Clean bathrooms. Kitchen nearby. Breakfast included. Lots of other activities
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: The bed is too soft, and the mattress always sags when I lie on the bed
Positive Reviews: The breakfast is free and there is an air conditioning

Positive Reviews:
1. Arrange the lower bed for me

Very spacious lockers for luggage and lots of storage space next to the bed.
Also pretty big beds

Review Title: Excellent value for money, lovely staff and atmosphere.

Negative Reviews: Breakfast could have been a bit better.
Positive Reviews: The staff was very cooperative. Cleaning was good and the air conditioning was pretty good too. Overall satisfied. Matea and Maral were pretty friendly at the reception. Would love to come back some day.

The hostel is really well-located. It’s close to a metro line, making it easy to get around the city. There are lots of restaurants & supermarkets nearby for food. 

The hostel itself was really nice. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially with booking activities. It was clean and luckily, the room I had also had A/C (but this is not the case for many rooms).

The location is great. It's near the metro station and the tram sops,  There are cafes, pharmacy, Asian restaurants, and supermarkets in walking distance.  Chain Bridge, Parliament, Fisherman's Bastion can be reached by walking too. 
The dorm is with AC and its spacious.  The tip based free walking tour is a bonus.

Review Title: Excellent place in the Central Budapest
Negative Reviews: Not many local food options around, mostly fast food, beer isn’t cheap at the bar, towels aren’t included.
Positive Reviews: Great location, new facilities, comfy beds and clean silent rooms, basic breakfast included, good Wi-Fi connection and fair quality-price value.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Great place for exploring Budapest, good atmosphere and amenities
Negative Reviews:
I picked this hostel because of the curtains on the bed, and was pretty sure that I specifically selected a room with such pictures, but it turns out there are also many dorms that don't have it, and that's what I got. This could have been clearer. Those standard beds were very squeaky, any tiny move would make a lot of noise. 

AC was unfortunately broken and that was bad timing, cause it was +30 degrees the whole time. Luckily after the first night we got a fan which helped a lot. 

There seemed to be few toilets for the amounts of people, 2 shared ones on my floor with I think 4 dorms, it was often a long waiting time. 

As a few small suggestions, I would maybe add a mirror in the rooms, hooks on the beds. Would also be great for breakfast to have maybe cheese and ham for putting on bread.
Positive Reviews: I really enjoyed my stay here. The place had a great location, great facilities, and shops and public transport close by. Everything was clean, comfy bed, decently sized locker (though needs own padlock), also hooks in the room, personal light and socket. The breakfast is included and has a decent selection, and the hostel also offers free dinner if you spend 4€ in the bar, which was really nice. Because of this I didn't end up using the kitchens, but they seemed in order, also there were many fridges. Staff was ok friendly overall, but some could be more engaged or knowledgeable about their own hostel and activities. I liked that there were people of all ages and interests, so could find likeminded company.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Review Title: Very good value for money, lovely staff, had a good stay overall.
Positive Reviews: Kitchen area was nice. Hostel was modern and stylish. The dorm room was spacious and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Positive Reviews: Bathroom was clean and the capsule around the bed provides privacy.

Staff was very helpful , specially staff member: Moral who showed me the placed and helped me in finding directions etc .
The walking tour guide Amarender was great day to know the history of Budapest . He is very kind and humble to keep the group together ,looks like a hardworking guy.
For solo travellers it's budget friendly with breakfast option so definitely recommended

Positive Reviews: Very friendly staff, breakfast included (even includes eggs and vegetables) , get free dinner if one spends 4 euros in the bar, bed has curtain for privacy, bed has charging socket, there are TV, board games, darts in the common room

Positive Reviews: Location and price

Negative Reviews: My trip got delayed and they sent me a message threatening to cancel my reservation, which was paid in advance. When you arrive, you have to give 5 euros deposit for the card key. I didn’t have it, the lady from the reception said it was hostel policy. I came to the policy here in booking and didn’t find this information, which for me is a big deal since I never ever carry cash. I took a screenshot of the policy of the hostel in booking and there is nothing saying “bring 5 euros cash for deposit”. Long story short, she ended up allowing me to get the key and added a note saying I didn’t give the 5 euros.
Positive Reviews: The bed was comfortable, there was a fan in the bedroom, breakfast is good, and the ladies who work in the kitchen were very kind. It is a good value for money, the location is just perfect.

Review Title: take a closer look at the staff at the reception. It seems like they are doing you a favor when you contact them.
Negative Reviews: One of the huge minuses is the receptionist. If I'm not mistaken, the name is Moral - she's very rude and never smiles. It so happened that one of the excursions that I booked was canceled at the last moment and I returned to the hostel upset, I decided to consult with her about what else I could see and how to get where - she answered Google it and turned away. I also repeatedly heard complaints about her from other hostel guests. but what surprised me most was when I wanted to do a check-out and my taxi to the airport was waiting for me downstairs - she said I don’t have time, I’m waiting until the night shift comes to replace me. I said that I had a plane in 3 hours and heard in response - I told you to wait, I don’t have time. so this employee is the only negative impression. Otherwise everything was fine.
Positive Reviews: First of all, I want to say a huge thank you to our guide for an interesting and fascinating tour of the city🙏🏼 I really liked the way he told it with humor and interesting facts, I advise everyone who stays in the hostel to join the walking tours. Kumar Amrendra, thanks a lot!!! secondly, I want to say about the hotel itself, location, cleanliness and amenities - at the highest level. good breakfast. and all this for such a price - this is the best combination of price and quality.

Great location — you can easily walk to the city centre and the train station, convenient public transportation to the airport at any time.

Very friendly and helpful staff, nice atmosphere, convenient time for breakfast.

A lot of free activities. Big thanks to Kumar Amrendra for the free tour in the city centre, that was insightful and really interesting😊

Negative Reviews:
☕️ The breakfast isn't in various types; there is still no cheese or any meat, margarine, but not true butter (please remember about the price of your stay!). Although you can eat enough, adequately for half a day to explore the city!

💤 The pillows are so soft that they need to be folded across to be comfortable while sleeping. Maybe it's time for a change?
Positive Reviews:
🗺 This hostel's main and constant advantages remain unchanged: convenient location (metro, trams #4 and #6), close to the train station Nyugati, and a short walk to the city centre and the Danube. In addition, the breakfast offered is unpretentious in its variety but filling. Access to the hostel via electronic card. There are plenty of shops, bars, fast-food restaurants, etc. around.

🎯 The renovation of the exterior part now makes it much more pleasant to enter. The hostel still offers a lot of activities and options for spending time, ranging from going on a walking tour of the city through games and fun for guests in the hostel to the offer of a relatively cheap meal if you buy any drink at the hostel bar in the afternoon.

🛋 Located in another wing of the building, the 8-person room had a separate kitchenette with everything necessary to prepare meals, a fridge, and sanitary facilities (two bathrooms for 4 rooms). The room itself is very spacious and really comfortable.

👦 Thanks to the Reception desk staff, especially Oleh!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Positive Reviews: The hostel is located in a very suitable place in terms of accessibility to the metro, tram and buses. It is also very close to some important sights. Bathrooms are regularly checked and cleaned throughout the day. The staff are mostly helpful and friendly and finally I also liked the breakfasts.

Negative Reviews: Experience varies from to room. This review is for my this stay and room only. The idea of capsule bed is interesting. The room was small, so not comfortable to move around and to keep luggage. Fortunately the room had spare connected room where I kept luggage. There was an issue with my locker. Another person at reception told me it will be fixed, but it wasn't at least during my stay.

Negative Reviews: Hardly anything - lift feels rickety, but wasn't! Can be disconcerting stepping outside to a balcony to reach room, but not an issue. Make sure you have plenty of notes (euro or HUF) when checking in as deposits for keycard and towels
Positive Reviews: Arrived late at hostel, but used the MiniBud transfer system booked for us in advance by the hostel, which is great value if you are in a group of 3 or more. Metro stops about 23:30 hrs, so didn't want to take the chance of not being able to easily get to the hostel. Ignore the entrance way (currently undergoing building work and looks rough) but once you get thru the hostel entrance (on 1st floor) all is good. Nice check-in and bar/breakfast area. Great that breakfast included and our room was comfy & clean. Location is ideal - v. handy for Metro and Trams 4 & 6 (which connect you direct to Buda side). Walking you are 20 min or so from Heroes Sq in one direction and Parliament in another. Plenty of decent food options nearby as well.

Review Title: Great stay yet again. We have stayed here before and would 100 percent book again.  Great location.
Negative Reviews:
No advisory for guests leaving early in the morning not to pack their bags on top of the top bunk as it will shake the whole structure and awake everyone.

Please pack the night before or do it on the floor.
Positive Reviews:
We have stayed at this hostel before.. but this time we stayed in a different room type.

We liked fhat our room had a fridge and a small kitchen area this time as we could spend our day at the nearby thermal baths and then just jump home to the hostel and make ourselves a snack meal (saving money and also time) before grabbing a shower and heading to bed.   After spending the day at the spa we were exhausted.

The beds have privacy curtain around them that make it almost like a capsule hotel like set up.

There's WiFi and there are cupboards..  but you do need to bring your own padlock for these or buy one.

We had no issues except for one night when some room mates staying in the top bunks decided to come home late cook at 11pm and then proceed to pack and unpack at 4am in fhe morning on top of the bunks.. meaning fhat everyone was disturbed..  they left at 5am and everyone got to sleep again.

Every other night was more or less peaceful and undisturbed... but fhis is always fhe risk of booking a shared room.

I recommend using fhe privacy curtain and using earplugs and you should be okay.

Have your booking on your phone for when you arrive as you'll be asked for it.  First time this has happened to me for a while as I usually book online and just give my name on arrival.

It was nice fhat the hostal now offer sandwiches all day round at reception for 1 euro.. so you can arrive even without the local currency and have something affordable to eat.

This made a big difference for us as we arrived late at night.

You also need to give a 5 euro deposit for your room key but we were aware of this as we stayed here before.

Would recommend and would book to stay again.
The all stuff, place, events in the hostel was amazing. You shouldn't check any other place if u come to Budapest.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Positive Reviews: Good review :)

Negative Reviews: The price of the towel and they only accept cash creates problems.
Positive Reviews: It was the best clean, neat hostel and great breakfast for this price.

Review Title: It's worth staying here, at least for a few days, to see if it's worth coming back (4th time here)
Negative Reviews:
The space in the room is quite smallish, with all six persons here it can be a bit tight. If you get the upper bed, the process of getting up may be a bit difficult - the position of the ladder is not very effortless and requires some acrobatic skills from you 😀

The room can be a bit muggy and hot, so during the night I recommend opening the window a bit to let fresh air flow 😴
Positive Reviews:
🙂 I am staying here for the fourth time (price - quality - location ratio); for the first time in a 6-Bed mixed Capsule-Style dormitory. The windows overlook the inner courtyard, so this is an option for those who like silence: you can't hear any street noise at all. This room is on the 2nd floor, but you can still use the guest kitchen one floor above.

☕️ In the morning, there is a breakfast option (included in the price): without cheese and meat, but still a filling meal so you can eat plenty.

🚿 Despite the hostel being almost full there were no queues for either the toilets or the showers (if everything is occupied on your floor, it's worth checking on another one).

🚪 The main entrance and stairs are being renovated, so it may be a bit inconvenient. Therefough results are already visible: the unsightly inscriptions in the corridor have been removed and the walls have been painted.

🧳 Thanks to the reception guys - Oleh and Vyom - for helping with changing money, quick check-in/check-out and printing the boarding card.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: Bathroom in the dorm room is practical, but toilet is in the same place as shower. With 8 people it can be difficult to coordinate/wait. Small very soft pillows :/ It wouldn't be a big investment into something comfortable.

The bathroom had some major funk smells. Believe it was from the drains. Easily mitigated by closing the bathroom door. Just not great to go in to use the bathroom. 

Breakfast time was really busy with shoulder to shoulder people walking around. Not a big problem if you’re ok with this atmosphere, but could be unpleasant for some.
Positive Reviews:
Can beat the location in downtown Budapest. Super value deal. We had our own room with private bathroom, so it was just like a normal hotel. 

Breakfast was delightful. Cereal, boiled eggs, veggies and toast were just some of the items offered. 

Room was very clean and beds were sturdy.  Reception was very courteous and helpful. 

I recommend this place as a great location to stay for a night or two.

Review Title: If it were not for the Red Head girl, the short bar tender, okay.
Negative Reviews: There was a red head girl at the front desk I did not like because she was often ride with me and other guests and did not speak to me or offer any help with my registration. However, after visiting Budapest for several days and interacting with people in Budapest, she is the typical Hungarian who is rude, unkind, and aloof. One of the bar tenders was nice bit the short bar tender was rude, and often stared at me without speaking and made me feel very uncomfortable. I suggest you talk to the Red hair girl at the desk and tell her to be nice to all travelers and also the short bar tender.
Positive Reviews: All of the staff with the exception of 2 were wonderful and very courteous and helpful. I especially liked Mateo and Jenny who went above and beyond their responsibilities to ensure I had a safe, comfortable visit in Budapest. It was my first trip and if it were not for Jenny, and Mateo, I would have left Budapest sooner. I found the local people to be rude, unkind, and racist.

Review Title: Maybe too big hostel? But still a very nice concept.
Negative Reviews: Bad experience with roommates. Something I've never had before. Lights on in the middle of the night, slamming with doors, watching movies without earphones. Noisy and arrogant. Not what you expect while staying at a hostel. Different vibe at the dormitries. Maybe because of the size of the hostel that this attracts people that normally wouldn't go there? It seems like (for some people) it's just a "cheap hotel" and they are not looking for the cozy hostel, sadly.
Positive Reviews: 5th time in Budapest and I always take a different location. This is by far the nicest hostel as a concept. Everyday another activity... Free breakfast... Positive Reviews:
◇Cozy hostel with staff always willing to help.

◇I loved the heating in the dorm (just the right temperature).

◇Kitchen was fine.

The WC, shower count is very limited. There are quite many rooms, beds, so it's causing some difficulty to be have to waited long.

Positive Reviews:
The hostel is about 10 min walking from one of the train stations and about 1 min from a metro station.
The staff  was omnipresent and helpful. Special thanks to Daryna and Oleh from the reception desk. 
The breakfast is always the same but there is plenty of it, so it's not a problem to stuff oneself for a good half of the day. 
If you spend at least 3 euro at the bar there, you get a dinner coupon. It's different every day of the week and it's plain but good, not just a snack to your drink. 
The facilities were always clean and tidy. 
There are lockers but you have to have your own padlock. Or just buy it at the hostel.

Positive Reviews: Well located, clean, big lockers for backpack

Negative Reviews: It better to prepare for some medicine, since guests may get sick at night and all the pharmacies are closed. Emergency happens all the time.
Positive Reviews: THE LOCATION is near the house of terror (100m away), also walk 15 minutes to some castle. With free breakfast and also free dinner if purchase 1 drink there. Every floor has individual kitchen, which u don't have to share with many people which is quiet. 24 hrs stand by.
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: If there is one more mirros in the toilet, that would be perfect.
Positive Reviews: Comfortable bed, good quality toilet paper, hair dryer which i love the most. Clean room. Always have staffs come and check the hygiene. Very great!
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Positive Reviews: The staff were super friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a lovely touch to help with the budgeting. Everywhere was really clean and tidy. Great location and felt very safe as a solo traveller
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: air circulation in the room.
Positive Reviews: Served good breakfast everyday and night dinner was also served for those who took drinks. I extended my stay for one more day.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews:
You have to rent a towel for 4€ (or buy it for 7€). There are lockers but you need to bring your padlock or buy one from them, but it was not a problem for me because I kept my laptop at the reception.
Also the washing basins are too small, at least on my floor.
Positive Reviews: Awesome hostel in the beautiful city of Budapest, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the atmosphere is great. I also liked that each bed has a curtain for privacy, and that breakfast is included. What an amazing value for money this hostel is! I will definitely stay here again in the future :)

Review Title: Excellent Value and Vibe at Avenue Hostel
Negative Reviews: The bed is hard and pillows not firm so that depends on your comfort, we were a bit sore. Also, there is a cheaper dorm room with no curtains which seems silly since every other around it has them and it’s such an easy addition to make everyone comfortable. Small costs to make travelers happy and rested on their expeditions. :)
Positive Reviews: This is a pretty great hostel! We are fairly aged (30-40s) and have done so many hostels in our youth that now we rarely do. The facilities are great for what you are paying for in this location and we don’t think we could have found better. Yes, it is mobbed with a ton of people, but the staff does a great job organizing it and making sure it’s clean and comfortable. The breakfast is awesome and well done! Each floor has a little chill area. Bathrooms and showers are easy to access and always available. The staff are super friendly. Great views from upper level rooms.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Review Title: very nice location and nice city
Positive Reviews: very nice with free breakfast and also dinner for 3 euro + a drink
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: The beds wen't that comfy, especially the pillow. The breakfast was plain, but given that it was free, I cannot complain too much.
Positive Reviews: Staff was kind and helpful. I noticed that pay a lot of attention to cleaning and maintaining of the property. There was a shared kitchen and a fridge which I found very helpful. Location was very good.

Negative Reviews: The lockers were quite narrow so my bag wouldn’t fit in although there is a separate mini locker above the beds you could use for valuables, food wise the €3 dinners are very small as other reviews point out (on the night I had it you got a sausage sandwich) however as it’s so cheap this is to be expected so it’s a good little snack rather than a meal.
Positive Reviews:
Great price for what you get, curtains round the bed all allow for proper privacy while you sleep and included breakfast and social events at the hostel a few times a week is great! Breakfast included is always a plus with options being cereal, toast, mixed vegetables and eggs- (could definitely be improved with some meat/cheese/pastries but you can definitely fill yourself up!)
Toilets, showers and kitchen areas were always super clean as well and staff were chatty and accommodating- great value for the price!

Review Title: Started out bad. I was assertive and  they responded
Negative Reviews:
I was told hostel had no beds. As in full
 I had checked Bookings. com and showed rooms. I told the receptionist and she said no beds available. So, I booked on my phone and told her I HAVE A BOOKING. She felt embarrassed and got her supervisor. I explained to the supervisor what happened. He took care of things and helped me book for four more nights the following day.
Positive Reviews:
Great breakfast
Centeral location
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Review Title: One of the better hostels I did.
Negative Reviews: Airco was broken in our room.
Positive Reviews: Beds were placed in a direction so you had a lot of privacy.

Negative Reviews: The room was too small for a 8 bed dormitory. Felt like lack of proper ventilation. On a sunny day, it's too hot inside- without proper ventilation or wall/cealing fan.
Positive Reviews: Overall experience was good. Friendly staff, clean bathroom & free breakfast.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: The entrance could be improved
Positive Reviews: Everything besides de entrance

Negative Reviews:
In my room (6 beds), the beds doesn't have a curtain of privacy and the plugs for charging stay on the bed, instead be fixed in the wall. Must be adapted. 
Few toilets, considering the number of guests.
Positive Reviews: Good location, helpful staffs, clean, good breakfast, excellent cost - benefit.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: A bit noisy with the traffic and the bars below
Positive Reviews: Great location: 15 min walk to loads of things, or get the metro, bus or tram which are right in front. It was very social, lots of activities and events going on.
Amazing value for money, excellent location, fantastic breakfast and squeaky clean. It's hard to find any fault with this place, I can only recommend it to everyone.

Negative Reviews: So loud at night

Review Title: Great for partygoers, good for others at a good price
Negative Reviews: Squeaky beds and noise while sleeping. Bring or ask for earplugs.
Positive Reviews: Great breakfast and kitchens. Clean bathrooms.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Review Title: Fantastic stay. I will miss it.
Negative Reviews: The only thing I can say about the stay is that the noise of the ambulances is very irritating. But after a few days you get used to it and it's not like it's the hostels fault.
Positive Reviews:
Had a magnifique holiday! The staff has been very nice from day one. Everything was as expected. Clean rooms, showers, toilets... 
Very friendly people working in the hostel. 
They preserve dinner (even vegetarian option).
Had a lot of fun during the activities at the bar (drinking games, darts, kahoot...). 
Great energy which leads to a great atmosphere within the hostel. 
I went out a lot with Sébastian (walking tour guide) and Andrès (Bartender) to local clubs. Party guaranteed with those guys. I can say we even became friends :). You can tell it's important for them to please the guests and give them a good time. 
I also met 2 girl bartenders who just arrived there to volonteer in the hostel. They are from the Netherlands and they are called Loes and Eliette. Very friendly bartenders also. They don't hesitate to have a chat with you when you order a drink and they always smile. 
To resume, I had a very good time at the hostel and I will go back for sure. I fell in love with the city and with the lovely people working at the hostel. 
Thanks for everything

Negative Reviews: It was a bit hot in the hostel (travel time in September, around 25 degrees Celsius during the day outside). But there was a powerful fan in the room that you could turn on. We had the windows open all night so it was a bit loud because of the traffic noise of the busy street down there.
Positive Reviews: I loved that the beds had curtains for a better sleep and more privacy. I stayed in a 10- or 12-bed dorm and the room was big enough and did not feel crammed. Showers and toilets as well as a kitchen were right outside of my room. It was never too busy so I never had to wait to use these facilities and there was plenty of room in the fridge. Breakfast is complimentary but as an early bird I always left the hostel before 7am so I cannot give more information on the breakfast. There is a locker room for storing your luggage before/after check-in/-out (bring your own lock) or if none of the lockers are free there is a little room/cupboard for luggage next to the reception.

Negative Reviews:
Yes, indeed, I stand by the opinions of guests who have experienced the heat this year. Even though I was there in mid-September, the temperatures reached +30. There is an AC in the 6-bed dorm and it works, but it's weak, so we had the windows open almost all the time, which, of course, added to the street noise. There was a fan in the room, which was enough for a 6-person room (although it makes a lot of noise).

The breakfast is filling (there's plenty to choose from), but it still lacks some meat or cheese.
Positive Reviews:
The main advantages of the Avenue Hostel are the location (metro Oktogon line 1, tram #4 & #6 stop, not far from railway station Nyugati, close to the city centre), attractive price, breakfast included option. I must admit that the quality of coffee for breakfast has improved.

Good and stable Wi-Fi signal, kitchenette (if you want to prepare something on your own), possibility of eating dinner (buy something at the hostel bar for 1200 HUF/3 EUR between 6 PM and 9 PM, and you will get a small but tasty dinner dish).

It's possible to store luggage and print your boarding pass at the reception (greetings to the Ukrainian part of the hostel team!).
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Positive Reviews: The amenities provided with the stay.

Negative Reviews: No AC
at the entrance it was dirty and a little scary
Positive Reviews: I loved the location and close to everything.
Room Type: Bed in 10-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: There's no bed railing, but I almost fell down from the second floor It was a dangerous moment :(
Positive Reviews:
Various languages & continuous cleaning services. 
Especially thanking the Argentino staff

Negative Reviews: No elevator and our room on 3rd floor
Positive Reviews: We can cook and staffs are friendly and helpful.

Negative Reviews: The beds were located on the second floor of the room, so it was not so comfortable even for a 1,6m height person. It would be better to notify guests about this.
Positive Reviews: Easy check-in and check-out, free breakfast was simple but good. The staff was super friendly.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: clean and comfortable social hostel with good price
Negative Reviews: The girl from the front desk could have been more friendly.
Positive Reviews: The best hostel I stayed in Europe. Very quiet and comfortable and the facilities were cleaned every day. It was very easy to make friends during breakfast and the dinner was really cheap and yummy. Centrally located and they organize events for travelers. I wish I could have stayed longer.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Good stay for friends or a city break
Negative Reviews: Small private rooms, breakfast options could be improved.
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, free luggage storage, breakfast included in the price, clean, games and get together activities at night.

Negative Reviews: The rooms should have had air conditioning. Without air conditioning, it can be challenging to sleep at night if you're traveling in the summertime. Other than that, I liked everything.
Positive Reviews: The location is amazing, tram and metro stations are within a 2-3 minute walk away. The breakfast is amazing and offers a wide variety of foods, including cereals, eggs, coffee, milk, juice, bread-butter, and salads. I booked a bed in a mixed-gender, four-bed hostel and was given a room on the top floor with a wonderful view(go for 4 bed mixed dorm). Make sure to bring your own padlock. I made a lot of friends in this hostel, I highly recommend it.
Room Type: Bed in 4-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: Nothing

Positive Reviews: Very social hostel with many activities. Good price and location. Clean enough.

Review Title: Price-performance is great! Plus, location & breakfast!
Negative Reviews: My bed was making noise when I turn my aside. The socket for charging phone was not easy reachable especially for short cables  it was almost impossible. No help in check-in before 2 pm even tho you arrive early. But they keep your luggage.
Positive Reviews: Location and a kind of open buffet breakfast is excellent for this price. The hostel is close every point u wanna visit as walking distance. There are lots of activities they serve and and different types of accommodation in rooms are provided. Overall, I liked it really.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: The check out receptionist wasn't friendly and was talking to me in a very strict way like if I am staying in his house and living from his money. Didn't even try to help unlike Soma for sure.
Positive Reviews: Everything was fantastic specially the front desk guy "Soma" that was very friendly and helpful and answered all my questions with a smile specially when he knew that is my first time in Europe. Thanks for such a nice place and for sure will come back for it.

Review Title: Very confortable and great to meet people. Clean and organized installations.

Review Title: Perfect accommodation in the center of Budapest
Negative Reviews: I might just mention the broken dresser drawers in our room, but that's about it.
Positive Reviews:
Everything was sparkling clean, cozy and nicely furnished. The staff was always in a good mood and very helpful. The location of the accommodation is excellent, there are many cafes, restaurants and shops nearby. The most beautiful monuments are about 30 minutes walk away. Metro station (M1) is right in front of the entrance, which is a huge advantage.
The buffet breakfast included basic items such as toast, eggs, vegetables or cereal with milk - nothing to complain about for the price.

Negative Reviews: Noisy (but makes sense since Its in the centre), no air conditioner, it was Very warm in the room
Positive Reviews: Good location, nice and helpful staff

Negative Reviews: Breakfast was not enough. There was no cheese or ham. There is only a fan to cool the room when it is hot.
Positive Reviews: The hostel was in a great location. You can easily reach it by M2 metro or Tram 4-6 from Oktogon station. There are Burger King, Mc Donalds and Starbucks very close by. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is a suitable place for those travelling alone or with a group of friends.

Negative Reviews: My room looked a bit different from the pictures, although i believe it probably depends in which room you get to stay. Would have liked blinders
Positive Reviews: The athmosphere was great and the people were friendly. You can get a small dinner for free if you buy something from the bar for a specific amount.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: There were only two showers on the floor that we stayed on which at a busy time in the evening was not ideal - not the end of the world but had to wait
Positive Reviews: Good location, good vibes from reception onwards, common area was great and lots of activities on offer

Negative Reviews: The room was rather hot. With the fan it was okay, but there were not enough fans to cool down all the beds.
Positive Reviews: The location is very central, the staff is very friendly, and there is a nice atmosphere in the common area. They have cheap dinner and included breakfast. The bed is comfy and they have individual lockers in the room right next to the bed.

Review Title: Amazing experience in a very well located hostel
Negative Reviews:
The ground floor of the building is pretty ugly, although that's not the hostel's fault, they could try to improve that.
It was pretty hot and there were no fans in the bedroom to cool down the room.
Positive Reviews:
Incredible location, close to multiple trams, buses, and the train station.
Super spacious rooms with very comfortable beds. 
The staff was great, especially Sandra, who helped us with all the hostel activities, explained the city, and even hung out with us. She was a lifesaver and even tried to convince us to stay longer in town.
The hostel has multiple activities every day, a very good-sized kitchen area, and offers meals, drinks, and a free breakfast.
Everything was super clean and it was possible to always see someone working on cleaning something.
This is one of the best hostels I've ever been to. I made friends in town so I'm definitely staying here again next time.
If you don't feel like going out at night, you would certainly enjoy the hostel activities at night, highly recommended.

Negative Reviews: Aircon did not work even though they stated it did, 34 degrees in a dorm room is not fun. We had one fan in the room which helped, but they really need to fix this and it made the stay uncomfortable in the heat of summer!
Positive Reviews: Great location, close to everything and right on the metro/tram line! Lots of staff however it’s really busy, so they are needed.
The view from the rooftop was priceless. The location was absolutely unrivalled. The staff were helpful, chatty, and kind.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Review Title: Great hostel. Price match my expectation.
Negative Reviews: The stairs to my bed-too high.
Positive Reviews: The atmosphere, the breakfast, the colourful design and the price. Location was great and the service was perfect. Thank you for having towels in the hostel!

Negative Reviews: The traffic sound was loud so don't forget your earplugs!
Positive Reviews: Great hostel with front door access to public transportation like metro and tram. The staff were all great and it was no problem to check out early in the morning.

Review Title: I like the time I spent in Avenue Hostel.
Positive Reviews: Staff was very friendly just like the people which were in room with me. I would recommend this Hostel to everyone, and I would visit it again, perhaps this time with someone along.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Great location. Easy to get trams and buses everywhere. We got a group transport pass each day for the family. Breakfast was good. A change from the norm, but certainly encouraged me to eat healthily. Staff were all friendly and helpful. We had a private room and it was huge. Toilet cleaned every day. Whole place was very clean. We used the buy a drink and get a free meal a couple of times. Good filling meal. It was very hot and room had a big fan. Balcony was lovely for drying washing and just people watching.

Review Title: Volunteers Ricardo and Sebastian were so friendly and helpful. They made the hostel more sociable with games nights and
Negative Reviews: The rooms were a bit stuffy without aircon

Clean and comfortable! The evening dinners and free breakfast were a great bonus!

Negative Reviews: The pillows were a bit flat - but I'm sure if I asked for another I would have received one
Positive Reviews:
Really nice to have your own privacy on your bed with the curtains, and great to have a nice kitchen space and bar in the hostel. 
Great location, and good vibes all around

Negative Reviews: The room didn't have ac, the fan helped but it wasn't enough. Sweat through the first night, the second night someone puked in my room, which is part of the experience and I got a new room which was much cooler. I really disliked that the lockers built into the bed, which is a great idea, where shoddily built and were easy to rip open with minimal force, due to it being a poor lock where only the size of the lock was holding plyboard back. The plyboard would just bend or chip off if you pulled a little and then anyone could access your stuff. Lockers downstairs where better.
Positive Reviews: I liked the atmosphere and the breakfast, price was amazing.

Especially the number of people working is high and as far as I can see, the cleaning never stops. Don't have too high expectations for breakfast but still acceptable. Thanks to Matte as well as Oleh,Petra and Sonia for their help. Love u Budapest ✨

Felt like he was always working the bar! Give that man a break or a raise! Dina was also great, made me feel very welcome :) Good breakfast included with tables set up to share space and free luggage storage. They have a real cheap dinner most nights and usually something to do at night, which is great if you're solo traveling. They also have little common areas/kitchens on each floor which is cool too.

Review Title: Vibrant & happening place, for people of all ages!  A real bargain for downtown Budapest
Negative Reviews: more of a structural thing -- the bathrooms "in" the room & also the main area are kinda small & therefore get "watery" very easily -- but the staff is approachable about these kinds of things.
Positive Reviews: They do a FANTASTIC job of creating community!!! Super-cool to see everyone interacting with new friends! An absolutely fabulous breakfast. Staff walks you to your room & settles you in! Great option for dinners (buy a drink at the bar, get a free dinner!) A space to cook & store food. Bunk beds have lights, plugs & are cozy/comfy. Lockers in the room & also pre- and post-stay storage. Free walking tours. ALL Staff are totally approachable -- so -- if something's wrong (ie. if bathroom needs something or has a problem) tell them!  Location is just enough "outside" of the tourist area, but close enough to walk there. Easy-peasy access from the train station. My second time to stay there & I'd stay again! Just get over the bathroom & toilet area being too small & hard to keep clean (water drainage) -- it's not a big deal, given the other "positive" things.

Negative Reviews: 12 bed dorm was not the best. 8 beds together and shook everytime 1 person moved or climbed the ladders. Known issue and fan in room and windows open to compensate but not hopeful it ever gets fixed. Was very hot in the room. People apparently been out to fix but heard its been going on for a while so if it ever will be fixed I don't no. If you want decent working ac, maybe search a place that actually has a unit on the wall

Key cards was also not functioning for the entrance of the apartment and for our room. They gave us keys. They also tried to fix the door lock for days but was not succesful until we left. But it's totally fine. Maybe it should be placed in booking.com that the living room I'm the apartment is being shared for two rooms, so visitors would know and expect it. Also to also place that the visitors will do their own dishes after breakfast. Nothing wrong with doing the dishes after. But maybe, better to place at the hostels description online and/or be said while checking in. A fan would also be great during summer season.

We are a little overwhelmed with the noise when we came in since we didn't know that there is a party that eve/night at the kitchen/ area near reception. The receptionist during the time we came, the guy one I don't know his name, forgot to ask but he was really really nice. He showed us first the room, he was very polite, and just with exceptional attitude towards visitors. 
The room including the living area/kitchen and room is wide. The toilet/bathroom is already big enough. Room is also ok for two people. Breakfast is good too. Toilet and Bathroom and also being cleaned everyday. Garbage inside the room are also being taken daily. This hostels is near restos, public transport stations, money changers, groceries, etc.
Great location to public transport - to get to the more touristy places but not central to them - and very close to the main station.

I could only spend the night there as I had a flight the next day but it seemed like a cool hostel. They had evening entertainment like board games and organised events for the people staying there. It looked fun. 
The location is great, just next to the railway station and it's in the heart of the city.
The staff were quite friendly and helpful too.

Review Title: Second time in a hostel in a year
Negative Reviews:
There are a lot of people, so there is always a lot of traffic, including in the evening and night hours. People who want to sleep may not have it easy.
Breakfast includes vegetables, an instant drink, milk (hot and cold) and cereals, bread and boiled eggs, jam, tea and coffee. However, there is no cheese or mortadella. Maybe something change from time to time so that it's not always the same, right?
Positive Reviews:
This is my second time staying at this hostel. The price is adequate for the services offered. An obvious plus is breakfast included in the price of the stay (I recommend coming for a meal not right at 8:00, but a little later - it will be less crowded and more space).
If your check-in is in the evening, or you don't want to cook something yourself or go to the store, all you have to do is buy a drink in the hostel bar for 1200 HUF (about 3 euros) and you will get a hot meal for that price (on the photo an example of a Monday set).
Solo travelers will undoubtedly find plenty of opportunities to connect and socialize with other guests, both at the hostel and in the city.
Convenient location (metro, tram), only half an hour to the Danube on foot. 10-12 minutes to Nyugati train station.
Pleasant staff at the reception (thanks to Oleh and good luck to him in his endeavors). There is an option to print your tickets.

Review Title: I really enjoyed it. Good ear plugs always help, in case the room faces a road or if neighbors snore
Negative Reviews: Towels are not provided but you have to either bring your own or buy one. Also, lockers without padlocks or key-doors is an interesting idea. So, again, you either bring your own padlocks or buy them. This is strange to have to pay extra for these basic things when people are trying to save money and travel light, I think. For example, at Klaipeda hostel all lockers had keys to them (logically) and 1 large towel was provided and changed upon request. Really great and thoughtful approach :)
Positive Reviews: Free breakfast that was included in the price. Nice option. Coffee, juice, toast with jam, bell peppers, cucumbers and tomatoes with boiled eggs, apples. They also offer dinner if you spend 3 euros at the bar. Different dish every night. Have not tried it myself, but looked and smelled good :)  The staff were very friendly and helpful, all of them! Every bed has a curtain around it which allows for privacy even in a room with 8 people you can have your own space. At the same time, one can also go to the public areas and meet lots of people. Really liked the possibility to leave the bags after check-out time until I had to leave. This is important. The location is great, it is approximately in the middle of Andrassy avenue, so about 30min walk to the Parliament in one direction or to the Heros' Square in the other. Also, any direction from the Oktogon Square is also worth going down. Beautiful architecture everywhere. Metro/subway station M1 yellow line is right at the square. Starbucks and some restaurants as well.

Review Title: Great location and price - worth it!

Review Title: Solid backpacker hostel option for great price
Positive Reviews: The hostel was a great value. Basic backpacker hostel, but they did stand out by including breakfast and a free (and pretty good) supper, with purchase of a 3 euro bar drink. The internet speeds were excellent, the shower was hot, and the bed was comfortable. The shared spaces were a bit limited (and commonly full), but overall, for the price, this option could not be beat. Strongly recommend for a short dormitory stay in Budapest.

Review Title: ONLY REVIEW YOU NEED. THANK ME LATER
Negative Reviews:
ANY MINUSES?
Yes there are, no free towels, that's with most hostels 

7 euro for laundry which they do for you. Bit steep. It's budapest and not Switzerland 😉

Detailed review to follow on youtube. Mark helpful if you found this review helpful 👍
Positive Reviews:
So, this is the ONLY REVIEW you need to ever read

Everything that a hostel should have, this one does.
Good location (octagon square)

Great breakfast with eggs (free breakfast with no eggs is not even worth anything ever)
Also breakfast time is good 8.30 to 11. Checkout is 11 am too (unlike many other hostels with 10 am checkout and breakfast ending at 10 am too)

Best value for money honestly in off season it can be as low as 9 euros going up to 25 euros in peak season and weekends. 

Perfect mix of party hostel vs quiet hostel. Doesn't go to any one extreme. 

Great common room and kitchen . Free luggage storage

Volunteers are doing good job , I met Andres from Costa Rica and Michael from France. Very welcoming and also the blonde girl at check in 

5 euro charge as deposit which you get back 

Small details in dorm rooms :
Beds are already made unlike many other hostels where they give you sheets and you gotta make them. Small thing but when you arrived tired, it's good to see a ready bed.

small locker IN ADDITION to large ones (a first)

Curtains for privacy (Small thing but many hostels don't have it)

Hanging hooks 🪝 (small thing but you will be surprised how many hostels don't have it, sometimes even in bathrooms they don't)

Good mattress + enough height for each bed, bottom or top with high ceilings

Review Title: A fantastic choice when the price sits comfortably within your budget!
Positive Reviews:
This hostel has a wonderful vibe. It feels lively at most hours, morning, noon and night, with it’s incredibly social and spacious reception cafe area, yet the bedrooms were still quiet when you needed to catch up on much needed rest! Bed was comfortable. All the important spaces were cleaned to a satisfactory standard and staff were always actively maintaining the spaces. 
The breakfast buffet is fantastic, with plenty of fresh veg, fruit, bread, cereals and more (only lacking a plant based milk option ;) ). 
Loved the colour. 
Staff were friendly and very helpful. 
There’s plenty of locker storage per bed (bring a padlock) and they are also happy to let you store bags before/after checkout for a bit too!
It’s well situated location wise within walking distance to two of the railway stations, but also has easy public transport options for when you’re feeling lazy.
I am really grateful to the Ukrainian guy at the reception. He was really kind and helpful.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews:
I was there on a weekend (Thu to Sun) and the hostel was obviously busy. 2 bathrooms per floor were not enough sometimes, but we could use toilets and showers on other floors.
Common area always pretty crowded, they don't have a large storage room so luggage was sometimes on the way.
Facilities are a bit old but functional.
Bit uncomfy mattress and pillows. 
No vegetarian option for dinner (at least from what I saw on the menu, but I didn't ask).
Drunk guests throwing up. Budapest is a party city and this is a problem everywhere in the centre (I lived here for over 7 months). I personally think hostels shouldn't offer drinking games nor alcohol until late, but I understand it's a good marketing strategy as it attracts people.
Positive Reviews:
Spacious and large hostel, many rooms on 3 floors. Each floor has a kitchen, 2 bathrooms and 2 showers.
Great location close to grocery stores and tram stop.
Great welcoming staff. There was a problem with the bathroom and they solved it right away.
Good breakfast included in the price, possibility to have dinner at the hostel for free by getting a 3€ drink. Tho, I couldn't get dinner as there was no vegetarian option available.
2 PCs free to use on 3rd floor.
Great wifi connection on every floor and room, good if you need to get some work done.
Cleanliness ok. Could be improved, but the hostel was crowded so it was ok.
Free earplugs provided.
No bike racks, but you can lock your bike on the balcony in front of the reception. 
Lockers in every room.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Excellent value, clean and great location.
Negative Reviews:
Each pair of dormitories (14 beds in total) shares two shower / toilet rooms and because of the key card entry system, it isn't possible to use facilities on another floor if both are occupied.  I had to queue three times in two days and at one point (I always seem to be unlucky in sharing with people who take extended showers), I had to wait 40 minutes to use the toilet.  Although the bathrooms are within a key-card access area, they are outside the dormitory so you need to remember your key-card to use the loo, otherwise you'll be locked out of the dorm.
The bed wasn't very comfortable and there was no pillow protector.
On my second morning, the breakfast area was extremely busy and there was nowhere to sit.
Guests are asked for a deposit of €5 or Ft2000 on arrival.
Positive Reviews:
The hostel is easy to find, located on the Oktogon, so well-connected to the rest of Pest and Buda, by tram or metro, with numerous shops, cafes, restaurants etc. in the immediate vicinity.  It's less than ten minutes' walk from Nyugati station and twenty minutes' from Keleti, whilst both Heroes Square (20 minutes' walk) and Vorosmarty Square (10 minutes) are easily accessible on foot via Andrassy Avenue.  
My first impression of the hostel wasn't good, with a long queue to check-in, but once I did, I was shown to my dormitory and given an explanation of how everything worked - the staff here are very friendly and helpful and the hostel is clean.  I liked the layout of the eight-bed dorm, with the beds back-to-back, so more like 2 4-bed dorms (but with very thin walls!).  Each bed has a privacy curtain, power point and reading light.  Although the main kitchen is downstairs (first floor - my dorm was on the second), each pair of dormitories shares a fully-equipped mini-kitchen (two ring hob, microwave and kettle) which should meet most needs and allows access to a kitchen at times when the main one is out of bounds (eg. when breakfast is being prepared).
Buffet breakfast is included and consists of bread (although there were queues for the toaster), jams, hard-boiled eggs, cucumber, tomato, peppers and cereals, available from 8-11am;  there is also a machine dispensing coffee or hot water for tea (again, there may be a queue).  The hostel also has a bar (spend €3 and get free food in the evening, served at 6pm - the menu changes daily) and offers a free walking tour daily at 3pm, on the first day after check-in.
Access to the building, reception and dormitories is by a single key-card and reception is open 24 hours.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Good location, next to tram stops & within walking distance of city centre, comfortable beds, big rooms, key access, bathroom in room, breakfast included (veggies, eggs, spices, bread, butter, jams, cereal, juice, tea, coffee), many international guests, spacious common area, nice staff.

Positive Reviews: The breakfast - included in the price - is really good and huge and a great way to meet other travelers. The staff is nice. Location is really in the center of Budapest all facilities are in walking distance. Beds are pretty comfortable and other guests are very nice too. Coffee at the breakfast is real good coffee, included all types of italian coffee (however from a machine). The hostel is located in 'Pest' on walking distance from the trainstation Nyugati or just one tramstop (4 or 6) get out at Oktogon square. There is also a metrostop 50 meters from the hostel (yellow line). For Keleti station take tram 4 or 6 to Blaha Lujza Ter and change to red metro line direction Ors vezer Tere, just one stop with metro. For Deli station take yellow metro direction Vorosmarty Ter, change at Deak Ferenc Ter to the red line direction Deli Palyaudvar, get out last station. Decent change offices for change money are several around the hostel. As are ATM's. Again the warning: never use Euronet ATM (unfortenately too many Euronet ATM's in Budapest).

A variety of rooms allow for single or many guests--on different floors. Staff are friendly, helpful and can offer MANY ways to explore and enjoy Budapest (even to a frequent visitor). It is on Oktagon off Metro, a few blocks from train station and on bus lines. Prices are reasonable for Budapest as well.

Review Title: Great staff, free breakfast, too hot in rooms
Negative Reviews:
During the heat wave it was unfortunately unbearably hot in the rooms (especially on the inner side where the window opened into the yard where you had 0 air circulation). The AC was a (big) fan  on the ground of the dorm room but only the people it was pointed at got any air. To be fair it was a pretty remarkably hot summer but you were pretty much sleeping in wet sheets drenched in sweat :(

Also, bring a lock with a thick metal thingy, the flimsy wire ones that extend don't work on these lockers. Maybe they have some to rent/buy at reception but I just kept my stuff at the foot of the bed cause I was on the top bunk anyways so - easy access

I stayed in two different rooms, one for 4 people with private bathroom and the other for 8 people with shared bathroom. I liked both actually, the room for eight people is devided in a way that every four beds have their own aisle, so it is like a room for four with shared entrance. The shared toilet was not crowded at all, I didnt wait even once for a shower or to use the toilet. It is overall clean, but a hygiene shower in the wc would be a great addition. The room for 4 has a great view outside on the octagon intersection with trams.
The rooms are very well sound-insulated from the public area, I didnt hear a sound from that side. But the street sound from the window was noisy. The trams are the most noise makers there. The beds are fairly comfortable and warm. There's a locker for luggage and small storage above the bed, a private socket and a lamp. Curtains on the beds offer some visual privacy.
The breakfast was very simple and basic; boiled eggs, vegetables, cornflakes, butter and jam, apples, tea and coffee.
Overall I liked the place very much, and would like to stay there in any future trips.
Good hostel! Everything was fine there. Special thanks to Oleh who was always there to support and answer questions! Great hospitality!

The top bunk has no railing to prevent you from falling out so I was glad I didn't sleep on that side :-).

Review Title: great price, location and facilities but terrible nights sleep
Negative Reviews: it was incredibly hot. really uncomfortably hot. there was one fan in the room but due to the positioning of beds in the 8 bed dorm it was only good for 2 of the beds so everyone else really suffered and couldn’t sleep at all because temperature was unbearable. also in most other hostels I’ve been there have been signs up reminding other guests to ‘be quiet after 11pm’ etc. there were not any of these here and as a result in the two rooms we were in guests were incredibly noisy, disrespectful and disturbed us. perhaps a sign would be a reminder. also the doors automatically closed and slammed shut really noisily throughout the night also disturbing sleep.
Positive Reviews:
so many great things:
location, breakfast was included in price plus as much as you wanted, 24 hour desk, staff really helpful and lovely, comfy beds, personal lockers, lock boxes above bed plus light and charging plug, towels and locks to buy, organised events, bar, free simple dinner. it was fantastic in almost every way.

Negative Reviews:

This definitely sucks but that's my only fault.

Oh ..since it's in the middle of a city, it does get pretty loud. So if you need your beauty sleep, undisturbed, I'd suggest bringing earplugs! ❤️
Positive Reviews:
So this is the second time I've stayed at Avenue. So here we go:
The staff are super friendly and helpful, they have a  24hr reception which is great, plus big lockers for storage space (both in the rooms, and out in the corridors)
The lovely staff show you to your room, right to your bed, which I think is super necessary, but not always done (just that little bit of extra care makes such a big difference). Super nice touch 

It feels really welcoming there 
They have bar crawls and parties advertised for every day of the week(!!)in the reception area, so you're sure to meet people if you're in search! (They're pretty awesome!) 
It's not a party hostel though, so you haven't got the same vibe as some others would be. However, the location is incredible! It's situated in the perfect place for travelling about!

Also the cleaners! 
You can see them floating around in a regular basis which is very reassuring, plus they have signs on the doors to encourage guests to report anything that needs attending to ("...we will sort it out ASAP")

There are 2 kitchens to choose from if you want to cook; microwave, hob, kettle, big sink space (downstairs), a fridge on each floor, and plenty of clean utensils to use (plus washing up liquid, sponges and clothes to use!!)

There are computers to use, they recycle, they have a bar, you can ask just about anything and you'll be greeted with nothing but help and smiles!

Negative Reviews: It was really hot in the hostel room, there was no air conditioner. There was one fan but it was not enough for all the people in the room.

Negative Reviews: The hostel is in an old building and it could be cute if only it got a bit of renovation. Even though it's usually kept clean it still looks like it's going to fall apart soon. My worst fear was the bathroom - for the whole floor (4 rooms, around 20-30 people) there are two restrooms: 1 shower + pee, 1 shower + poo. One poo place for ~30 people.  The poo one is also super tiny and it's not comfortable to shower there, so it is more like one shower for ~30 people too. If you need to stay somewhere cheap and don't really care about anything - it's fine, but I've stayed in many different places and I just wouldn't come back here, at least before some renovations happen.

Review Title: I have stayed in more than 15 backpacking hostels so far, I'd easily rank this in TOP 3 🧡
Negative Reviews:
1. The only problem we had was there weren't enough bathrooms. You always have to wait for 5-15 mins when needed, but it wasn't a big concern for me as i use it in the early morning every day.

2. Unlike how it is shown in the pictures, not all dormitory rooms have curtains on the beds. It's only on the ground floor rooms. So, if at all you book a bed, try asking them for beds on the first floor, or if you ask, they will offer you extra sheets to cover the sides of your bed.
Positive Reviews:
1. Breakfast was my favourite part. I would say that the breakfast (which was included in the bed charges itself would cost me more than what i paid for the bed. Full on value booking.

2. The receptionists were warm and kind. Especially, Oleh (Ukranian). He was always there whenever we needed something. 

3. The rooms were clean. 

4. In our 7 days of stay, we met people from 6 countries and made some good friends. 

5. The dining spot is big and comfortable. A good place to work during the rest of the day, or just have a chit chat.

6. Wifi is super fast. 

7. The surprise element is obviously the kitchen (includes a macro-oven, electric stove). You can cook anything you want, there are enough vessels, a kettle to make tea, all the plates, glasses and cups. 

8. As a student traveler, if I ever go to Budapest again, I wouldn't pick any other place.

Negative Reviews: the pillows were uncomfortable
Positive Reviews: we really liked the ambient of the hostel, full of young people. Also the kitchen was really good equipped.

Review Title: Good overall stay for one night
Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews:
Breakfast was delicious. Eggs/cucumber/tomato with fresh bread or jam/butter with bread along with the option of cereal, tea and coffee, etc, overall a range of options available.
Check in was really done conveniently despite my late arrival from the airport. 
Liked the concept of the floating security locker.
Each bed came with two sockets to charge my phone/watch.
Toilets were super clean and cleaned very regularly.
Hostel was located in a very central location, very ideal.
With the price paid, it was certainly value for money.

Anyway my grade is 9 and highest marks for all criteria.

Negative Reviews:
Unfortunately with all the great access to transport comes a lot of noise. When I read a previous review about this, I thought it can't be that bad. However, this person was not exaggerating. I know this isn't necessarily something the hostel can control, but if you are prepared before staying there it will at least not come as a shock.

One thing that was a little disappointing was that the photos aren't an accurate depiction of the hostel anymore. They are currently renovating the bathroom on the first floor so perhaps in a few weeks it will restored it former glory! However there is no beating around the bush about the state of the bedding and sheets which is quite frankly a little sad. 

But do you get what you pay for? Definitely. Maybe if the photos didn't set such a high expectation it wouldn't be as bad!

The location of the hostel is great! Everything is accessible by foot and if you needed, the metro and public transport is on the doorstep.

Review Title: This is not a European hostel, this is a hostel.
Negative Reviews:
The Indian employee at the reception was unfriendly, and he also dropped my passport, damaging the page, but did not even apologize. This is probably the culture in India. Every evening in the kitchen, Indian residents prepared dishes of their national cuisine and the smell permeated the entire hostel.

You need to understand that this is not so much a European hostel as it is a hostel. Be prepared that toilets and bathrooms will almost always be occupied.

Negative Reviews:
Breakfast times are strict
While free, the breakfast is high in carbs with most items high in sugar. Eggs, cucumber / tomato would be the healthiest option.
Each "area" has 4 or so rooms (a private, and some dorms of 8) with just 1.5 bathrooms. This can mean long lines to shower or use the bathroom.
Limited common space in the 'area' and in the reception.
Main kitchen by reception isn't for common use. The dining area is closed half of the day, so you'll want to go to a café etc.
Remember to get your deposit back for your room key!
All in all, if you know what you're getting into, it's a hostel and it was good for the price.
Positive Reviews:
Good location, near metro and tram.
Free breakfast (boiled eggs, apple, bread, sugary cereal, coffee, artificial juices, cucumber and tomato, tea)
Clean room - room of 8 (4 bunks)
Locker
Kitchen was clean and stove / fridge worked, though the facilities were a bit outdated.
Bed was decently comfortable and heated in the winter  (whether one of your roommates will decide to leave the window open all night...is another story)
They let you store your bags before and after check out. There's no guarantee they'll still be there.... But everyone seemed to trust the system. We put padlocks on ours.
Lots of people, so if you like to socialize, it's a good place
Wifi worked
Staff spoke good English.
And, we didn't see any bedbugs

Review Title: A decent option with a good location, but consider the cons before booking
Negative Reviews: According to the booking, the room was meant to have an AC, but it didn't. There was one fan for one room of 8 people so it was unbearably hot during both, the days and the nights. To try and cool of the room a bit, the window is left open basically 24/7 but since it faces the street there's so much noise of traffic and drunk locals / tourists which made it difficult to sleep and rest. Sometimes some staff seems a bit annoyed or uninterested in helping you, depends on who you interact with.
Positive Reviews: The location of the hostel is great -a lot of public transport connections and easy to find once arrived. Staff were mostly nice and accommodating. The beds, at least the ones in my room, had privacy curtains that were great for a hostel environment. They organize a lot of social activities too and try to get everyone involved. Also, it's great that it includes breakfast - boiled eggs, toast with spreads, tomatoes, cucumbers and cereal. It would be nice to rotate some extra options as that can get a bit repetitive depending how long you're staying there for, but overall it's filling and works well to start the day.
