Review Title: more hostels should be like Avenue
Negative Reviews: the entire building is poorly ventilated. it was more hot and humid inside than out. there is no smoking area, you have to go out to the street. there aren't enough luggage lockers in the building. i found one open cubby on a floor two levels down but it did not fit my combo lock (luckily i brought a tiny lock as well otherwise i would have had to buy a lock from reception). i swept the floor of the second room while settling in because i noticed it was dirty.
Positive Reviews:
first night in a cheaper room had a locker big enough for luggage directly below the bed and an ensuite washroom–this was exactly what i was hoping for. each bed had a small cupboard, shelf, and electrical plugs.
the next two nights i was in a bigger more basic room that cost €12 more and didn't have a luggage locker, ensuite washroom, cupboard, or shelf adjacent to the bed. they said the room had recently been turned over from a private room.
shout outs to my fabulous roommates Lou and Maria for being such great companions, the karma trust we established with other roomies worked well (no theft), and thank you Ricardo and Sebastian for rallying the troops for a super night out with many people from the hostel. overall good vibes from other travelers, loved the food and unlimited espresso, bar service was great, and i sincerely appreciated the 24-hour check-in, thank you.

When i was searching later that night it was again cheaper on the website. So be careful with the rooms and prices. 
Some noise from the shared spaces and from outside as it is a party hostel.

There is shared dinner at night and events on the weekend. 
There is a private bathroom in the dorms which gets cleaned every morning.
The location is great, a few minutes walk from the train station, the opera, the center, and lots of restaurants around.

Review Title: Great location  but lousy hostel mates
Negative Reviews:
We booked a private room but those who shared the common areas with us took the place as If it is their own and party right into the night and makes lot of noise. The walls are thin and not sound proof. It didn't help the the lights in the common room is automatic and keeps turning on whenever there is motion and doesn't even switch off after midnight and there's big frosted window in our room and it keeps lighting up as the curtains were not blackout.  The reception claimed we could inform them but there were no intercom and we had to go through the kids before going down. We fear for our safety and want no confrontation with them. They should provide a 24 hours watsapp service for us to inform the front desk of any issues.
Also the towels are worn off and not absorbent and I dun feel clean using it. The matteress are sunken and worn too. Not comfort. The pillows are mere pieces of broken sponges that are probably made from recycled kitchen sponges...very sad...
Positive Reviews: The Central location as it is a short tram and metro ride to everywhere and the hostel was great as it has common kitchen to make a hot drink and the occasional snack
Room Type: Double or Twin Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: it seemed to me that staff who were working on the reception were not really nice to guests. they always (like 24/7) seemed tired and sometimes it was really scary to ask them for any help))) There is just only one guy who was cozy and nice, but unfortunately, i didnt ask for his name, but! he has black hair. It was impossible to stay in the hall during evenings, because there always was loud music, you cannot hide from it on the second floor as well. andd one more- im allergic to dust, during the second night of staying my nose was itching as a hell, then i noticed that there was a ton of dust under my bed((((((
Positive Reviews: I absolutely love women who are working as a maids there! They always! were so nice and helpful, one of them recommended me thermal baths and other place to visit.
Thank for Oleh that he printed for us the tickets for free and helped a lot. Good location, perfect brackfast, all was clean enough. Thank you!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: Food, there was no omlet or cheese or bacon...
Positive Reviews: Location and atmosphere

Review Title: Good for a short stay (2 days max) and you might not sleep during the weekends, but the place is big
Negative Reviews:
-The dorms are not that well designed, especially the 6-8-10 bed dorms. The beds are all attached in the same metallic structure and your sleep will depend on how other people behave when they sleep, which is a big russian roulette. Sleep is why people pay for a bed in the first place so it is kind of a problem when this can actually affect your sleep quality. 
-It is crowded all the time, even more on weekends. The popularity and cheap cost of the hostel bring everybody, and not the best people. I think the hostel should be more aware of people who lack politeness. Also it doesn't help that much to make contact with people since it looks more like a university residency according to the hugeness of the place.
-The AC doesn't really work so people complain in the dorm that it is too warm and then open the windows, which brings a lot of noise since we are near a big avenue. I personnally didn't care about AC, but this comes back to who come to the hostel and how people act when they are no consequences from the management. 
-The towel is not included and it cost 4 euros, which is really expensive since they keep it in the end. And it brings a lot of money if you look at how many people come to this hostel everyday.
Positive Reviews:
-The place is big and clean
-The staff is helpful but some of them act a little bit rude (probably due to the constant rush of guests in the hotel)
-The breakfast is free (even if it is the exact same everyday though)
-The kitchen is big and well equiped to cook (important)
-Central location
-They do activities during the weekends at the hostel, if you are into this
-You can have a free dinner at the hostel if you buy 3 euros at the bar for a drink, which all in all is kind of a good deal. The quality of the meal vary everyday so it might not be your thing, but it is convenient

Negative Reviews: Not enough showers (not devided for 🚹🚺) or privacy. Basically no rules, so people was noisy in room in middle of the night etc. Entrance door are not really clear how to use code for opening.... everyone struggle, me included several times.
Positive Reviews: Comfy bed and very friendly, helpfull staff. Nice locarion next to coffee shops, rossman etc.

Negative Reviews: My stay at the hostel had both positive and negative aspects. The staff was kind and the value for money was reasonable. However, I encountered some challenges. There were noise disruptions during the night, including loud snoring and disruptive activities from a neighbouring bed that shook my bed. Additionally, the cleanliness of the toilet was subpar, with visible blood on the toilet seat and door. These issues detracted from an otherwise pleasant experience. Improvement in noise management and hygiene maintenance is necessary for a more comfortable stay.
Positive Reviews: I had a fantastic stay at the hostel! The staff was incredibly kind, and the value for money was exceptional. The breakfast was a nice touch, too. Highly recommended!

Positive Reviews:
🏨 Maybe, one of the most perfect localisation in Budapest: in nearby there are plenty of shops, cafeterias (McDonald's, Starbucks), bars, backery etc. The Oktogon metro station (line M1), bus and tram is almost in front of the entrance hostel's door. Only 10 min. by foot takes you to the railway station Nyugati.

🧭 It is not a very Budapest centre, but it is still not very far from the main destinations, where you would like to go.

🍽‍️ A simple breakfast that included in price (but enough for the beginning of your day) - is a very nice option. Additionally, if you buy something in the hostel's bar (from 6 till 8 PM) for the 3 euros, you can receive a plate with a supper (different meals for the different days).

🛌 A 12-person dorm is a large room, and the location of the beds and curtains allows for privacy. There are two lockers (bigger and another one, smaller, above your head on your bed). Socket and reading lamp above each bed.

🛎 Reception 24/7; plastic card as a entrance key both for main door and for you room. Print at reception what you need.

💶 Pay in EUR or in HUF.
friendly staff. cool atmosphere. Good job Ricardo do with the party

Review Title: great spot , clean , a bit loud
Negative Reviews:
Breakfast is really simple. if you are vegan as I am, our choices are bread with olive and veggies.
 Also, our room was on the street side so be prepared for loud noises as trams and ambulances passing by all night non stop. If you close the window, i suppose youre gonna sleep pretty well. 
They dont offer towels and you either can buy from the hostel for 5 EUR and keep it or loan for 5 and they give you back 2 .
There are locker rooms without padlocks so they make you buy one off of them CASH ONLY for 3EUR . At least you get to keep the padlock.
Also, on your way in there is a fee of 5EUR when you get your key which they give you back when you check out and bring them the kea card back.
So if you come from a european country, make sure you have some extra cash with you for that kind of situations that nobody prepares you for.
Overall , the hostel was a really nice place, with music playing and nice colors all around. DONT get intimidated of the scetchy hall when you get in the building. The hostel area is renovated and clean.
Positive Reviews:
a hostel in the heart of the city with trams 4 and 6 going both ways for all the 24h, Avenue is a great place to stay for your holidays in Budapest. Clean, affordable and cozy. Also, on the 2nd floor there is a big sitting area and the internet is more than fine !! T o be exact, we got internet from the hostel even when we were on the other side of the road! 
Also, the people we got to meet and live with for some days were all really kind and respectful, with every each of one being quiet when needed.

Negative Reviews: The extractor fan in the bathroom was a bit annoying, we couldn´t turn it off.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect! The hostel is very well connected with turistic places. There is a tram stop a few meters away, but if you prefer to walk, it is also a possible option. The breakfast is very good. In our case we stayed in a private room, the beds were comfortable.
Room Type: Double or Twin Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: Only the bathroom of the room was less clean and quite small. I preferred to clean in the common bathroom because of that. Also, think about bringing a small lock if you want to lock your wardrobe (otherwise they sell them at the reception).
Positive Reviews: Overall, the hotel is very good: the beds are comfortable, the sheets are clean and fresh, and the common rooms are cleaned regularly.  The service is also really nice: the reception is almost always open and the receptionists speak very good English and are very helpful. Having made a mistake in my reservation, I wanted to change my room for the night and one of the receptionists, Petra, immediately tried to help me to arrange it. I was really pleased by her quick and nice response.

The breakfast is basically bread and butter, but what do you expect from free breakfast. And it’s very noisy in the hostel! a bar.

Negative Reviews:

Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Cheap hostel with its pros and cons, free breakfast
Negative Reviews:
The beds are awful, the whole construction shakes all the time when someone moves in their beds or even walks around the room. It's terrible, I woke up every time someone was climbing the ladder.
It's very hot in the room, there is a fan but it doesn't help at all. 
It can be very noisy and crowdy.
The bathroom and toilet doors have very old doors and it can be hard to lock them. 
Sometimes you have to wait to go to the bathroom, there can be queues. And the facilities need renovation.
But I can't complain, really, it's the cheapest hostel I've stayed in (and I've stayed in many many hostels) so I don't think you would be disappointed. It's ok.
Positive Reviews: I liked the free breakfast and location, plus you can meet many great people there from all over the world. The greatest thing about the hostel is that it is cheap.

Review Title: Cheap & cheerful though with an uninviting , dingy  entrance and stairway up to  reception.
Negative Reviews:
The entrance lobby is dark, graffiti ridden and really uninviting. I realise though that this isn't actually part of the hostel itself.

Some more "comfortable" chairs/ sofas would have been nice.
Positive Reviews: The free breakfasts were good value - though some cheeses/cold meats would have been appreciated as well as the salad and eggs.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Disappointed by the breakfast, but overall a good place to stay
Negative Reviews:
Highly disappointed (except for the coffee machine) by the breakfast that was included in the price. It is quite limited: boiled eggs, + paprika, tomatoes, cucumber + apples + bread + 2 sorts of jam + cornflakes + some juice. No dairy, no fresh fruits (the freshness of apples is doubtful). Besides, it starts at 8am, which is quite late.
No bed curtains in my room, but I extended my stay and was allocated another room, where indeed there were individual bed curtains.
There are individual lockers in the room, but they are quite small and you have to bring your own lock. Some storage is also allowed in bigger lockers at the reception level, but the same principle (bring your lock) applies.
Didn't felt like a place where you can meet new people. Kind of cold atmosphere I would say.
3 times per week, there is a possibility of booking a simple dinner meal for 3 euros, that will be served in the hostel. I haven't booked it, but the portions looked quite small.
Positive Reviews:
Well-located. Good stable Wifi in rooms and common parts. Good unlimited coffee during breakfast. Clean linen. 
On the floor, 2 quite clean common bathrooms for several rooms with (rough estimate) 15 people all together and one shared kitchen. The kitchen was clean, but the both fridges were overfilled with products in a doubtful state. I guess that here the cleanliness highly depends on the people living in the hostel.
I think the staff do some "profiling" by separating "party people" and more "quiet people" into different rooms: I was lucky enough to be assigned in the ambience where I want to be, so thanks to the staff.
There was some noise from the tram passing by, but I could sleep quite well.
Beware : the stairs in the hostel look "ruin"-like and don't reflect the state of the rooms.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews:
the toilet in the bedroom is too small. 
no air conditioner
Positive Reviews:
The location is perfect, close to everywhere and also public transport just 1 step out. The facilities are okay. The bedroom with private bathroom is spacious and comfortable.
The staff is very patient and kind, especially Mateo at reception is very welcoming and friendly!. Finally, breakfast is always included in the price and it’s good enough. :)

Best breakfast I think I've had in a long while, set up that was well stocked at all times with cut tomato, peppers, cucumber, boiled eggs, cereal, coffee etc. Good spaces for meeting other people and being social as well as some spaces where people could work. Location is decent and easy enough to walk around or get a tram to/from.
good location, staffs are friendly.

Also im 30 yrs and like a more chilled vibe, hostel was bright and busy with young people .. All of which were amazing but it didnt have a quiet area to chill out with more peace.

the hotel is beautiful with a strategic location.

Negative Reviews:
We had to wait exactly untill 14:00 to start check-in, the receptionists didnt even take our passports before that and there was huge lane to START check-in. Then we were told that our room is not ready and we didnt get access to our room. Personnel told us that the room will be ready in 5 min and we waited half an hour just to find out that it wont be ready soon. After half an  hour they told us that we can put our staff to the room anyway (which is only thing we needed - to put our luggage and go to the city but we had to wait 1 hour for them to letting us do it in still uncleaned room). There was some very bad smell from ventilation and opening of the window only made it worse. 
The sound insolation was really poor and when at 3 am some neighbors came from party and were talking in the common area we could hear every word and it was impossible to sleep.
Elevator didnt work (and for us it was an issue)
Positive Reviews:
Location is perfect
Breakfast was nice

price was quite good

Negative Reviews: Everything was fine, the only thing that was missing and made the stay unpleasant was that there was no air conditioner and very hot in our room.
Positive Reviews: Chill staff, simple but not bad breakfast, the hostel is right in the middle of city centre

Negative Reviews:
The entrance to the hostel is not the best.
The location isn't great either. It's 30 minutes on foot from the centre, and also 30 minutes from the train station (Budapest-Keleti). For more or less the same price there are better-located hostels. Still, it's really close to the House of Terror museum. If you go to Budapest you should definitely go there!
There's free breakfast but I wasn't able to try it as it is only offered from 8 to 11, and I had to leave slightly before 8am to catch my train (this is not necessarily a con, but I wished I had known it before booking)
Finally, the area is not too loud, but I did have some trouble sleeping because of traffic and also because of some of my roomates who got back in the room at 2am and disrespectfully kept talking aloud and making a lot of noises.
Positive Reviews:
I slept here only because I had to extend my stay in Budapest by a day, and I left very early in the morining, so I had no use for the services and facilities offered. It was one of the cheapest options and it was over all fine, though there are better hostels in the city. 
The room I was staying in (an 8-bed mixed dorm) had big lockers for each bed placed on the ground, as well as a smaller locker inside the bed. I think adding that smaller locker was a brilliant idea, especially for those sleeping in top bunks. Beware that you need to bring your own padlocks (I think there's the option to either rent them or buy them at the reception, but it's always better if you bring your own). There are also a handful of lockers in the hallway. 
The bathrooms and halls were all in all pretty clean. Conversely, the top of the locker in the bed was covered in dust. But really a lot. It could use some dusting every once in a while.

Negative Reviews: Entrance..not easy to find
Positive Reviews:
Breakfast fine . helpful staff....location is fine..
good place to stay

Negative Reviews: Lack of A/Cs was a huge disadvantage during the hot weather
Lack of cleaning service in room, no fan in the room especially in summer season. Even after complaining they didn't make an effort to fix itl
Positive Reviews: Location and breakfast

Negative Reviews: The street is noisy day and night, since three is no aircon it becomes a a huge problem when it is hot - with the windows open it was impossible to sleep for me and I had to upgrade to the private room with windows on the side of courtylard. Could have more bathrooms. The breakfast is repetitive, but i think with this price it would be unfair to complain really :)
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, close to the Centre and with good public transportation next to the hostel. Clean. Every bed has curtains and its own pług and reading lamp. Three is even ATM on site (it charges a few though). Good price-quality relationship.

Negative Reviews: Drainage pipe in a shower room was stuck and water was overflowing at least 2 days. It was disgusting tbh. Also someone in my room checked in after midnight and a stuff attended him to his room and bed. The staff was talking to him loudly. I mean it was no problem if it was daytime but it was too much for late night.
Positive Reviews: My bank bed had curtains so I had more privacy than without them. Free breakfast was also good. The receptionists are communicatcble. I asked a request when I book and they responded quickly and provided me it.

Negative Reviews: It was too crowded and so hot. I just hoped that an air-conditioning system will be installed. I couldn't imagine if i was in a room for 8, could have been chaotic. Also, the sink inside the room was so small.
Positive Reviews: The location is very convenient and the price is reasonable.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: I tried their breakfast the first morning but after that I didn't ever go to check it out again on any other morning. They only offered juice, boiled eggs, one or two kinds of cereal, lukewarm milk (and not even with a lactose-free option), and untoasted bread with marmelade. I was honestly really disappointed that THAT was something I had uselessly paid for. Also the traffic noise from the street was awful, so earplugs were much needed when sleeping. Bring your own towel because sure, you can buy a towel at the reception for 2000 forint but it doesn't even qualify as a towel in material. It was more like a baby's soft blanket, pretty useless in drying yourself with. The cleanliness in my room was fine when I came, but they didn't change the common hand towel in the bathroom that everyone always kept using... And male cleaners didn't always knock and shoutout before they came into an all-female room to clean. Many cleaners, both men and women (but mostly men), were openly swearing in Hungarian in between cleaning rooms.
Positive Reviews: The location was spot-on, absolutely wonderful. Easy to get anywhere from Oktogon with public transport. Smooth check-in with friendly staff that would show you around and answer your questions. Keycard always worked. Staff present at the reception 24/7. Quick and smooth check-out by 11 a.m. (handing in your keycard and getting your 2000 forint cash deposit back). You got a locker in your room that you could buy a padlock for at the reception. Possibility to store your larger travel suitcase in a storage room next to the reception, although without leaving any name/details on your bag so basically anyone could just take it and at the reception they wouldn't be able to know it's not that person's bag.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

The breakfast was good.

The location is very good, you can easily reach Octogon square by Metro or tram (4, 6).
The security of the hostel is good, you can enter in the building and rooms only with your magnetic card (take care to have with you even when you go to toilet etc., otherwise you will be locked out). There are lockers in the rooms, but you need to take your own padlock, otherwise you can buy at the reception.
You can meet a lot of people, travelers, backpackers etc. and chat with them.

Hostel as its name says(avenue) is close to the main road and if the windows are open you hear lots of noises from the street. Beds have curtain from side but not from leg part, so you miss your privacy when you lie in bed.
Lockers have not a lock, so you should bring your own lock with you or buy it for 3 Euros from the reception.
I asked from one staff to change my bed to the one close to the window and even I said that I would change sheets by myself to not bother the staff but he said it was impossible as he couldn't change it in the system. When I read the review of others now I see it has been possible for other guests and just not for me.

Review Title: very good reception and comfy beds - but too expensive for Budapest
Negative Reviews:
1.) The old(er) breakfast lady - very arogant, very strict, very unfriendly - blond with glasses - this one ruined my perfect thinking of the hostel - this lady should by immediatelly FIRED!!!!
2.) Maintenance guy did not appear - nometter receptionest wrote the trouble into the system - (window handle was laying on the ground because of missing screws) so it was impossible to close the window, also the other pair of window had also broken window handle - so both pairs of the single window in the room were not abble to be closed - luckilly the weather was fine enough in the night and luckilly our widow faced the yard of the house - can not imageine if this would happen in the room facing the street - one of the most bussy crossroad in the city...
3.) The inside corridor along the stairs to the first floor where the hostel is located was wery dirty (this is wery typical for Budapest houses in city centre) but full of "tags" (form of grafitti) - should be re-painted by wall paint - because it looks really scary - comparing the perfect shape and relatively very cleen inside of the hostel space (the difference is like day and night) Its more than sure that it have been done by the guests of the hostel through out the time - so hostel owner should re-paint it without asking as a "guerilla painting"

reception - amazingly helpfull was Csaba and very helpfull was Petra

free wifi
private toilet and shower in the shared room - also showers and toilets on every floor

The toilet was always busy, the kitchen was so loud all the time we couldn’t sleep well, people was super load always at random times at night. I’m aware I paid for a room in a shared space but being a higher price for a room for 2 I’d expect to have similar people around us, sharing with a reasonable amount of individuals. Review Title: Nice atmosphere. But they should improve some things!
Negative Reviews:
1. The entrance to the building is unacceptable. You think you're entering a stable! 2. The breakfast is too poor (apart from the very nice coffee) They should add some more things. Otherwise, let them abolish it. 3. The space does not have air conditioning. Just a small fan. It's really hot and it's impossible to sleep in a shared space! Everyone had a problem. Whether they complained or not to the reception means nothing. And when I said it, nothing happened! 4. The independent rooms of 4, 6 or 8 people are too small. They also don't have good ventilation!
The owner should improve it a bit.. he has a lot of (young) customers.. he should respect and thank them a little more!
(I'm not posting the bad photos of the place that verify what I'm saying, and I believe that there will be at least some improvements that I'll see when I go again!
  With sympathy.
Panagiotis (from Athens)

I asked about the possibility of getting breakfast in the morning, at least some yogurt and muesli, but I was not even offered that. - It is very social place. As far as i know they they have different activities/games for every week (or day?), so that people can join and enjoy the vibe.  The lounge is also quite spacious, i find a new friend, a guy from Albania, and chat with him for hours. 
- The location is amazing, really center. Many restaurants and tourism sites around. I reach St. Bassilica  just by walking. 
- They provide a good breakfast : bread, cereal, drink, boiled eggs. This is what plus about this hostel. In the night, you also will get a cheap dinner (buy drinks for 4 euros and get a free food).

Negative Reviews:
It wasn't what I was expecting. The 8-bed dorm looked completely different than in the photos - I booked this place specifically for the privacy curtains and the private-looking beds but when I arrived, the beds were totally different: instead of having a solid wall to the bed, the side had big gaps so it never felt completely private, and some of the bunk beds were three-tiered which was NOT in the photos. I don't mind hostels, I'm just not a fan of misleading guests.

The dorm was also really hot which meant that the window was kept open at all times, and being located right next to a big roundabout, the noise of traffic was always very loud.

Negative Reviews: What's not to love?
Positive Reviews:
Avenue is perfect for a stay in Pest. Many reasons why, but I'll mention the wonderful staff first & foremost. AMR, who works the nightshift, is an exceptionally kind & friendly character. He's from Alexandria, Egypt, but brought up in Oman, a favourite country of mine: if you plan to visit authentic Arabia, ask AMR: he's yer man. Of course, I had more conversation with him, but let me praise other great staff: Mateo, Maral & Oleg. Thank you, dudes, for such a welcoming stay. They were able to fulfil my request for a lower bunk, and even upgraded me for my last night to a bed in the quieter 3rd floor apartment for no extra charge. Wasn't expecting special treatment, but what's not to love?
Easy & central to get to, Oktogon being readily identifiable, got a metro station, but also simply walkable from both Keleti & Nyugati train stations. 100E airport bus drops at Deak Ter, from where it's just a stroll up Andrassy boulevard past the opera. Which brings me to a key benefit: fear not if your flight gets in late, because reception's open for check-in 24/7, so no panic (just makes civil sense to advise them likely time of arrival).
Facilities are not mega (e.g. no pool table, clothes drying area, so if you've been to one of the many baths it may take a while for your towel to dry) but there are well-equipped kitchens on each floor, big breakfast (decent free buffet spread) which doubles as a bar later on, with big sports screens: a good place for meeting folk. It's a hostel with wide appeal with diverse nationalities & ages. The dorms are fairly standard, comfy enough, sufficient space. Toilets & showers just round the corner, and they seemed pretty well maintained, given that the hostel was naturally busy when I was there June/July.
And another significant thing: superb value for money, super-affordable for a well-run, safe, clean, comfortable central hostel in one of Europe's must-see cities.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Positive Reviews: I had an amazing stay at Avenue Hostel in Budapest. The hostel was excellently clean and comfortable. Csilla's exceptional hospitality and helpful recommendations made my visit even better. Highly recommend!

experience from start to finish. The hostel is conveniently located in the heart of the city, making it easy to explore all the major attractions. The facilities were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, providing a cozy atmosphere for travelers.

What truly set Avenue Hostel apart was the exceptional service. Csilla, in particular, went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. Her warm hospitality and extensive knowledge of the city made our trip even more enjoyable.

The common areas were vibrant and welcoming, making it easy to meet fellow travelers and share stories. The daily breakfast was a great start to the day, with a good variety of options to choose from.

Overall, Avenue Hostel offers fantastic value for money and an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend staying here, especially if you have the chance to meet Csilla, whose dedication to guest satisfaction truly enhances the stay. Thank you, Avenue Hostel and Csilla, for making my visit to Budapest so memorable!

The whole hostel was really clean, the room was spacious, there's even enough space to store multiple luggages next to and under the bed without disturbing anyone. The bed was comfortable, and there's a convenient little bedside lamp next to your head. The noise cancellation in the room is perfect, there's no noise coming in from the hallway. It was a little colder in the room, they were blasting the AC, I was a bit worried about this but I didn't catch a cold (and trust me, that happens very easily for me) so you'll be fine too probably. But the best and most shocking part for me was the free, buffet-style, all-you-can-eat breakfast. Although there was no meat, I could eat enough that lasted me all morning.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at this amazing hostel, and I can't recommend it highly enough! From the moment I arrived, the staff( Szabolcs and Mateo) made me feel incredibly welcome and went out of their way to ensure I had everything I needed. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortably furnished, providing a perfect sanctuary after a long day of exploring.

The common areas were vibrant and inviting, making it easy to meet fellow travelers and share stories. The hostel's location was ideal, with major attractions and public transportation just a short walk away. I was particularly impressed with the free breakfast, which offered a delicious and varied selection to start the day.

What truly sets this hostel apart is the atmosphere. It feels more like a home away from home rather than just a place to sleep. The attention to detail and the genuine care from the staff create an environment that is both comfortable and memorable. Thank you for everything.

Szabolcs and Mateo,
In addition to the friendly, warm, and helpful attitudes of the receptionists Szabolcs and Mateo, I would also like to extend my thanks for their advice regarding the hostel services/amenities and recommendations about Budapest.

Negative Reviews: none
Positive Reviews:
Exttraordinary value for money. Very good location at a junction of big streets. Clean room and bathroom with good hot shower pressure. Room and bathroom cleand on a daily basis. Small lift fit a folding bike. Folding bike can be stored and locked outside first floor (the front office) at the balcony, locked onto the iron fence. Access to the building and rooms are with key cards.

ATM and soft drink vending machine is available on the first floor. We can use the kitchen and its utensils to cook our meals.

The free breakfast provided is  basic but healthy and satisfying: milk, boiled eggs, cereals, bread, butter, three types of marmelaide, cucumber and tomatoes all you can eat. Plus coffee and two types of tea - black tea and fruit tea. Similary, spend Euros 4 on drinks, and we get a free simple but satisfying meal in the evening.

What made Avenue Hostel special is its treatment to guests. I accidentally made 2 reservations - one direct on its website, and another one with booking.com. By rules since I didn't cancel any, I need to pay both. The front office staff, Ms. Petra, was kind enough to consult with her manager on the phone, and made a fair arrangements such that I only need to add the price difference between the two platforms for the first night.

One day after I checked out, its finance department made a mistake by charging my credit card. After I returned to my country, I wrote requesting Avenue Hostel to take a look to this case. Mr. Oleh Podolyan, its Front Office Manager, replied to my message. Three days later I received the refund.

Review Title: Excellent value, fun, people, breakfast and bar... I'd go back anytime
Negative Reviews: Dinner was free with a 4 euro drink at the bar, and was just ok tasting and a rather small portion (but to be fair, it was very affordable and unexpected). I would recommend going for dinner at one of the local kebab shops where you can get a full meal size for around 4 euro. The dinner is very much "student food", and to be fair I've not be a student for a long time and so eat quite a bit different normally. I very much recommend the free breakfast though. Also, if you do not buy a drink with a free dinner token (as in you just buy the drink) the drink costs half as much. So the bar is very good value.
Positive Reviews: Breakfast was excellent (and included with the accommodation). Free ear plugs were also offered and very much appreciated. The beds are more like pods because you either have curtains closing your bed off to the rest of the room, or you have an actual pod, which just has a small opening to the room (and you can get a free sheet to cover this opening if you prefer to be totally enclosed). It made for a much more pleasant night's sleep than a hostel normally would be for me. There are mostly secure storage units in/next to each of the pods, which you will need a pad lock for (you can rent one cheaply from the desk or bring one- I don't know how much they cost as I had one on me). Every night at the hostel they do some sort of activity with the guests, which helps you meet new people. They also have a social group WhatsApp, so that you can easy interact with the others guests that are there during your stay. I'm on the older side, so wasn't really trying to get involved in a lot of that, but I thought it was really lovely and it did help when I had questions (as I was able to ask them in the WhatsApp group and get responses right away without having to go down to the front desk). There were also a few other older people around the place that seemed to also be enjoying themselves, so this place is great for older and younger people alike. The bathrooms are very clean. They also will send someone up immediately if they ever need to be cleaned right away (they have multiple signs posted telling you this, but from what I saw they kept up on the cleaning very frequently so I never needed to reach out). The whole place is very clean. I'm returning there again at the end of my holiday, and will be very happy to stay there after that as well from time to time as I pass through Budapest. I've even asked my husband if he'll stay there with me when we pass through together, because I feel like this place is just such good value and is a bit fun!
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room

Positive Reviews: Everything great, great value for price. The receptionist we’re absolutely amazing, very comprehensive!

Review Title: A bargain for what it offers you.
Negative Reviews:
The entrance is a bit strange. The bathrooms could be biger. But guys, notice that I’m just trying to find something to complain. Overall, the experiencie worths a lot.

Keep in mind, of course, that this is a hostel. So you kinda have to deal with some lack of privace, and stuff like that.
Positive Reviews:
It’s basically a bargain, but also, all the staff are really, really friendly, specialy Szabi and Vyon.

Also, it is placed in a WONDERFUL location, close to Oktogon (an important  intesection of the City) , like 1 minute or less from the station in wich pass the main line of the City, for the tourists (line 1).

If you want (and I defnilly recomend) you can easily walk to the main atractions, in a mater of minuts (3 or 4 to Ópera, like 15 to the shoes and chain bridge, 20 to the Parlment).

The guys serve some drinks and stuff on the bar ( I recomend the hot chocolate, 2 euros) and there’s a promo in wich you expend 5 euros on something, and gain a free a meal.

There is a breakfest, simple, of course, but with bread, stuff to put on it, eggs, some vegetables, cereal and even a coffe machine. 

We also made a guided tour with a guy that works on the hostel, Sebastian. Got to say it was one of the best guided tours i’ve ever had, and i’ve been to a lot. It is free, but of course, it is recomendable to contribute with something, since the guy provides you a service, btw very well.

About the accomodations, one thing that I loved is that the beds got courtains. Also, altough the place in the entrance and main hall might be a bit louding, the doors of rooms kinda have an isolation, so it is quiet to sleep (as long as youre room mates are not loudy, lol).

They got one bathroom for each floor, with 3 showers (private).

They let us store our luggage atill the night, on the day we left it.

Finally, the vibe of the hostel is great.
probably the best hostel in Europe in terms, how they take care of guests. Special thanks to Oleh and Daryna. With them  this place is so much better.

The Avenue Hostel exceeded my expectations was spotles. I had a great experience with there. The front desk staff is extremely efficient, pleasant, and helpful. Thank you for Mateo for the warm welcome and the help with all my needs. The property was very clean and has a fantastic vibe. The bed was super comfy. I will always stay at this location when travelling to or through Budapest.
Thank you, guys! You are the best!
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Toilets were regularly cleaned therefore were very tidy. A very nice kitchen with all essentials, utensils and cutlery was there for the disposal of the guests. Lockers with each bed were also there. Just bring a padlock and a towel and you will have everything.My room at the third floor was very calm, quite and spacious. I really had a comfortable stay at this hostel. 
Great value for money! Highly recommended 👌

I am a heavy sleeper so I can handle but a lighter sleeper would struggle.
I appreciate many guests only stay for a night but there are guests that stay for days.

I would like to suggest if possible to please put notes in the dorms to please be considerate of other guests at night.
Positive Reviews:
It had everything I needed, bed, shower, breakfast traditional meals even for vegetarians and that’s a must for me, snacks, a kitchenette and laundry all at a reasonable price, location is great just pay close attention when looking for the building.

The place is complete really if you are on a budget.

Review Title: Overall, our experience was very nice, combining affordability, cleanliness, and a warm community atmosphere. The minor
Negative Reviews: The absence of a lift from reception to rooms can be inconvenient, especially when carrying heavy luggage. Additionally, one of the male receptionists during check-in displayed a somewhat unfriendly and rude tone.

Negative Reviews: What can you complain about with such an affordable price and helpful staff?
Positive Reviews:
Clean shared toilet and shower room as cleaning staff regularly cleaned them.
Reception staff was fantastic. I highly appreciate Dora who lent me a helping hand when I told her that my phone was damaged. She immediately offered help such as using her phone for my sim card so that I could complete the 2FA to log on to my email.
Although it's a large hostel - you would see a lot of travellers there, the hostel would make sure people could have a good balance of social engagement and peaceful rest at night. Plenty night events at their bar. Staff will also assist In case of noise (that's extremely important as a way to show that they care you)

The staff was a professional, well-organized and coordinated team. I spoke with Jenny about any issues or concerns about my travel in Budapest. She was always so attentive and helpful to my questions about Budapest. I felt comfortable to talk with all staff and that was important to me. The location of this hostel is incredible. It's called "Avenue" because the building is located at the connection points of all roads leading to the best tourist destinations in Budapest, such as the Chain Bridge, Hero's Square, and more. The free breakfast every morning is incredible. It is buffet-style with free coffee and tea. Go here and you will not be disappointed by the professionalism, location and services.
Fab vibes, excellent value for money

Review Title: Stay & enjoy Budapest in the best way!
Positive Reviews: I got a really comfy room up in the 4th floor, lucky me away from the street noise. Room size could be better but nothing to complain about considering I stayed in an 8 bed dorm. Private bathroom in the room and plenty of common toilets and showers all around the building, as chilling and common areas as well to meet fellow travelers. The whole staff is welcoming and friendly, specially Daryna that checked me in and Estefania who works in the breakfast (which is, by the way, really good). No time to get bored since the hostel organize parties and events almost every day, as well as free walking tours and 24/7 receptionist will help you with anything you need!! Price/Quality? Best deal in Budapest!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

The vegan breakfast buffet at the main hall is decent and convenient (+ free coffee machine). There's always something going on as well in that vibrant main hall.  It is well located with a metro station directly next door if you want to go to the center. Or you can just walk through the avenues while checking out those fancy stores.

Negative Reviews: The entrance hall that you go through to get to the actual hostel gives abandoned house vibes but it really just hides a gem of place! Also heard from the staff that they're working on renovating the entrance hall.
Positive Reviews:
The hostel exceeded all my expectations! The daily free breakfast buffet was impressive: there was bread you could toast, jam, butter, boiled eggs; cut cucumbers, tomatoes and paprika; cornflakes as well as milk and fruit. The dinner they offer is fine too: you get it for free by spending at least 3 euros on drinks at the bar. Great option if you don't feel like cooking! The whole hostel (excluding the initial entrance hall) is decorated and furnished well, the staff is dedicated and helpful. They also offer a free walking tour of the highlights of the city which I highly recommend - Sebastian is a great guide! The hostel also organises activities throughout the week which is a nice way to meet people, especially when you're travelling alone. 
The bathrooms and toilets were clean and looked very nice. I had an upper bed, the bed linen was clean and you don't need to pay extra for it. I truly have no complaints: this is the best hostel I've ever stayed at!

Really good international Hostel! The People who worked there are really open &helpful! (:
Would go there again!

This hostel is a great value for money. It has a convenient location to explore Budapest and many local restaurants and bars nearby. The rooms are in an apartment with a card access system, which provides security. Each room has its own bathroom, kitchen and small table for socializing. The hostel also offers many games to have fun. The bar prices are low and there is a free dinner offer if you buy something from the bar. The breakfast is free and has a variety of options in addition to the buffet.

It's a shame we couldn't stay longer to join some of the group activities (game night, kahoot), but overall we had a great stay and will definitely be back next time we visit Budapest!

Negative Reviews: The hostel is located in a very busy and noisy square, so that all the noise from the street comes to the rooms during the day and night
Positive Reviews:
One of the best hostels I've ever stayed while traveling!

It's big and perfect for meeting other travellers.

The huge advantage is that even if you share a room with 7 other people, the beds are separated from each other and provided with a curtain, so that you can still have your privacy. 

The bed is very comfortable and there are 2 outlets and a lamp for each bed. 

The toilet and showers as well as the kitchen and rooms are cleaned and kept in order regularly by the cleaning staff. 

There is a quite spacious lobby with several tables and sofas, so that you can work if you have to. 

The breakfast from 8 till 11 is included and actually very nice: eggs, veggies, apples, cereals, jams, butter and bread + juice, coffee, hot chocolate for drink. 

The staff is super friendly.

Review Title: If you’re in budapest, stay here 100%
Positive Reviews: Everything. Super affordable, good breakfast, free warm and tasty dinner when you buy a drink for 3€. Fun game nights, comfy beds with privacy curtains charging outlets and lamps. Warm showers that stay running as opposed to the push button ones in other hostels. Thank you sebastian for hosting the kahoot night

The dorm was spacious and comfortable. I liked the all-you-can-eat breakfast with cereals, salad, eggs, bread and coffee or tea. The free map of Budapest was very helpful when my phone's battery was low. The staff were responsive and very helpful. And thank you, Daryna, for your patient and professional guidance!

The staff are super nice and the facilities are amazing, they even have an ATM now inside the hostel. Avenue was not my first time but the second time and it is still the same quality as 5 years ago. Positive Reviews: It is the best hostel in Budapest. Very socialising, good sleeping conditions, clean, not noisy. Very helpful staff, 24 hr reception, card usage, lockers.

Review Title: It's all about the people. They made the place awesome.
Negative Reviews: They have check ups on the rooms. I don't know if it's for the air conditioning or something else, but it was really hard to sleep after 10/11 am with those noisy unsolicited visits. Besides that, everything was pretty good. Great price, great food, great people (shoutout to the ones that helped me during my 12-day stay: Sonia and Andrés)
Positive Reviews:
My stay at Avenue Hostel was truly remarkable! Sonia, Andrés and Petra, part of their team, made my experience unforgettable. Their warm smiles and genuine care added a personal touch throughout my stay - I can say the same for my friends. Sonia speaks Portuguese - my language - so that was a plus. 

The hostel's cozy rooms were clean and comfortable, providing a peaceful retreat after a hard day of exploration and work. The communal areas fostered a friendly atmosphere for meeting fellow travelers.

From the delicious complimentary breakfast and dinner to the free Wi-Fi I was blown away. The availability of lockers and a 24-hour reception desk added convenience and security, specially during club night :D

The hostel offered easy access to iconic landmarks and free tours, which was very nice. The staff's recommendations helped me make the most of my time in the city.

In summary, the hostel provides exceptional hospitality. Its cozy rooms, amenities, and prime location make it an excellent choice for any fellow traveler. I can't wait to be back.

Such a modern and clean hostel in an excellent, central location. The hostel is a buzz of activity and the free breakfast and free evening meal (if you buy a drink at the hostel bar) all provide good opportunities to meet people. Highly recommend!
Friendly super international atmosphere. Nice and very helpful staff. Comfy and well planned sleep areas. Open to check in 24/7. Breakfast included and nice.

Review Title: A centrally-located, upbeat, clean hostel with budget-friendly prices.
Positive Reviews:
The hostel is located in the centre of Budapest near Oktogon, just a 5-minute walk from Nyugati and also Wesselényi utca, Király utca, etc so location is perfect :). The hostel has many-many rooms, even floors and large friendly common areas; making it a buzzing meltingpot of a hub for fellow travellers. The atmosphere is chill and friendly.
The staff is always friendly and well-informed. A big plus for me is that they are striving to honor special requests (I have severe vision loss). The rooms are as-described; cozy, clean, well-equipped. What more could you ask for? :) Oh I forgot the included delish breakfast, but keep in mind that you can opt-in for the yummy dinner options (check the blackboard behind the reception).
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room

Review Title: Excellent hostel for all backpackers needs
Negative Reviews: Luggage storage has small space and always full to the lobby in check out time.
Positive Reviews: This hostel is organized and has good team work to serve all guests. The highlight of the hostel is free health breakfast, and also free dinner if pay 3 euros to order drinks or alcohol in the bar. The room space is sufficient with window and bathroom, and not only one time housekeeping in one day. Printing and laundry service is also available.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews:
I was not feeling well so I asked if I could check out at noon, they declined so I guess lack of empathy. 
Bed makes lot of noise when someone climbs up. 
Please don't put knives like that in the kitchen, you never know people.
Positive Reviews:
Great location, everything is 20 mins away with train. If you walk maybe half an hour. Very cool option to have free dinner, if you buy a drink, breakfast is okay too. I'm not sure why people complain about free BF. Their coffee is amazing, can't believe it's free. 
Hosts Mateo and Jenni were very nice professionals, they help with everything you ask for. If you have a question or need help, please ask!! 
They let you store luggage before and after your stay for free unlike other hostels. 
It is hard to locate in the beginning but it has very convenient location, just look for Starbucks sign. 
They ask you to put a 5 euro deposit, which you'll get back once you return the key. It is a regular practice in Canada so I was not surprised at that.
My room was comfy. Roommates were nice and respectful. Curtains!!!!! There was a kitchen as well which I didn't use but great to have.
The free walking tour was excellent - Amrendra was friendly and so knowledgeable. Huge plus to my stay.

The location was amazing too, there are several public transport options and is close to many restaurants as well as turistic attractions. The staff was amazing and the breakfast too.
it’s a very friendly place, nice environment and breakfast. I also like that they provided some activities at the hostel. great for who’s traveling alone

There are privacy curtains in most of the rooms, which was perfect. I slept well. Price is good. I really enjoyed there (I kept extending my staying again and again and ended up staying there almost 2 weeks) and want to come back! Review Title: absolutely brilliant little stay in central budapest.  we wish we could have stayed for longer.
Negative Reviews:
We didn't have many negative things to say about the hostel as it was much better than we could have imagined.

You must bring a padlock for your storage locker as it isn't provided - and you need to bring a five euro note for your room key deposit.
Positive Reviews:
This hostel was extremely good value for money.  We booked three beds and the room was more like a capsule hotel than a hostel.

The bed was a little hard, but there was an individual reading light and two storage boxes (one built into the capsule) and one large one which would easily fit a large rucksack beside the bed - which also doubled as a bench.

The room was mostly quiet - unfortunately we had a few young girls in the room who came in and out at 4am in the morning and played music whilst others were sleeping - until we asked them to turn it off.

The hostel has a no tolerance policy which is good - so everyone gets a good night's sleep.

The room had a keycard system and everyone in the party gets a key - you need to bring 5 euros for the deposit (even though this isn't Hungary's official currency) and you get it back so long as you don't lose the card!

The showers and bathrooms are clean and the staff are always cleaning them.

The breakfast buffet is great for a hotel and there were hot and cold choices.  Breakfast is from 8am-11am and the tables and breakfast room is always clean.   You can eat as much or as little as you want and hot tea and coffee (as well as hot chocolate) are also available.

The location is great! It is within walking distance of everything.   We actually walked to the thermal spa and to the city centre for our walking tour - as well as to and from the airport bus stop.

There is also a metro station right beside the hotel as well as a tram stop.

Supermarkets are also within a very very short walking distance - and the 'house of terror' museum is only 2 minutes walk away too.

Large-scale hostel, clean, good breakfast, reasonable operating system
 + very friendly and nice staff (julie, argentina)
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews: First of all, there are no locks on the cabinets in the rooms. If you want to get a lock, you have to pay a certain fee. The size of the room was good, but I saw that there was a curtain in the images, there was no curtain, the beds were not comfortable. Breakfast was a complete disaster. Bread, cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers. There were also oats and cereals. But if I knew breakfast was like this, I wouldn't have chosen this hostel. Because I chose it for breakfast and location.

Positive Reviews: I highly recommend this Hostel. Very clean, the hostel has spaces to socialize and have fun and also quiet spaces if you need to work with your laptop. Super friendly staff (the reception and cleaning staff). Also Stephanie helped me showing the facilities, she was very helpful. Thanks!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Negative Reviews:
Everything was great!

A suggestion for the capsule beds might be to put some clips on the frame to make it easier to hang towels or sheets for privacy. Other people in the room had something up, but mine was too small to easily tie to the frame. Some guy kept accessing the locker under my bed during the night, and I really wish I could have had something to get some privacy and stop the light coming in!
Positive Reviews: Very welcoming, friendly staff. Excellent location, excellent facilities. Rooms and bathrooms were clean, bright and well-furnished. Breakfast was great - coffee, juice, fresh fruit, eggs, toast and cereal. I only stayed for one night, but I could see that they had some really nice community options such as a pub crawl, walking tour, and a bar and dinner options on-site. I stayed in a capsule-style bunk, and there was one large locker under the bed and a smaller one on the 'inside', both able to be locked separately with padlocks. Dorms are secure and accessed with individual key cards.
Room Type: Bed in 6-Bed Mixed Capsule-Style Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: It was a bit warm in the common area
Positive Reviews: I've been to nearly 30 countries staying mainly at hostels and this was the best. This is where you want to stay if you come to Budapest. They were constantly cleaning, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was good for a hostel, it was in a great location, the staff were sooo kind and helpful. I loved it there.

I absolutely believe that Avenue Hostel is the best hostel in Budapest. I received high quality service from check-in to check-out. During my trip to Europe, I extended my stay at the hostel several times. Surprisingly, despite the extremely good price-value ratio, the included breakfast is also extra good. The cleanliness of the hostel exceeded my expectations, there is cleaning every day of the week at least until midnight. The hostel organizes various activities, so - among other things - there is an opportunity to taste Hungarian food in the form of a free dinner, participate in walking tours and participate in drinking games. The guests in the hostel are extremely friendly, I made a surprising number of friends thanks to the hostel. The staff without exception strives to satisfy the needs of their guests; I would especially like to highlight the work of Nikola, who helped me personally on several occasions with questions arising in connection with my reservation.

I can definitely recommend Avenue Hostel to everyone!
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Private Bathroom

Review Title: Amazing place in the heart of Octogon
Positive Reviews:
Fabulous. The very first impression after staying overnight there.
 Perfect location, cleanness, staff attitude and price. Frankly speaking, that was one of my first experiences staying at hostels, but I couldn't find any difference with many of the  hotels with 3 or higher stars except your were sleeping in the common room.
 But even that issue didn't make any inconveniences as you  had a curtain around your bed. Clean and tidy shower/toilet rooms, towels available on request for a small fee, no need to wait for using facilities as there are a couple of them in the property. Breakfast consists of toasts, butter, jams, vegetables, cereals, coffee, tea and some drinks.
 Special appreciation comes to the staff.
 Charging cable was provided on my request.
 Another team member, named Oleh, was really useful and amazingly kind at explaining everything around. Speaking with multiple languages his Ukrainian was absolutely wonderful to hear..
 Would recommend this place to stay for any person or family (family rooms are present as well) who would like to receive an outstanding service and facilities worth its money

Negative Reviews: The bed was short
Positive Reviews: The area is central,the staff is kind

The staff is great, the reception works 24/7 and they regularly clean the toilets and rooms. The kitchen and lounge area is also exciting! Would recommend and will probably stay here again.

Review Title: WRONGLY checked in and someone in my bed!
Negative Reviews:
I was WRONGLY checked in in someone's else bed (we had similar name).I did a normal check in in the afternoon and later in the night I left to go to the city. When I came back at 4h30 morning I HAD A GUY SLEEPING in my bed. All my stuff that were in the bad were put in a plastic bag at the reception. Receptionist told me to go up and pick up my luggage and go to another room at 5h00... Terrible mistake and experience. No compensation given by the hostel, only a "sorry we made a mistake"... 
I'm changing my evaluation score as the only answer from customer service was a "sorry, we're human beings". That's why we give our identity during check-in, so you can READ our names. It was a disaster to arrive 4h30, get scared by someone in my bad and discover that all my stuff were in a plastic bag in the reception (underwear, pyjamas). I paid 166€ for 3 nights, the least we expect is to be able to sleep peacifully.

Positive Reviews: The location was good, close to the trams and underground stations. The breakfasts were also quite OK, and the staff was ready to help at all times. Also there are a lot of events that are happening almost every evening.

Review Title: Very good breakfast and reception but the dorm rooms were boiling.
Negative Reviews: The rooms had no air conditioning / was not working and was boiling hot inside and 1 fan between 8 people in dorm. Bathrooms were also not very clean.
Positive Reviews: The breakfast was very good and delicious and had many options also.

Review Title: It was worth, but I wouldn’t recommend it.
Negative Reviews:
The gusts itself wasn’t kind as well, even though there’s plenty of requests (from hostel staff) to keep the silence and be quite after 10pm, it was very loud and lots of guests was coming in super noisy at 2am/4am into the room witch I can’t blame the hostel, as it is expected to people to have comum sense. 
The reception and kitchen staff was very kind and helpful, besides the awkward situation on my check-in when they requested me to pay a deposit for the key (witch was fine for me) the awkwardness is that the fee is 5€, and when I gave the guy a 20€ he asked me to keep it, and when I said no, I want my change he in fact have the change witch make me wonder why would him ask to keep the 20€ when he had there the change. 
The cleaning stuff made me fell real uncomfortable one morning when I came into the bathroom and as I saw them there asked if i could use the toilet or not and they said “yes you can” and them when I was getting ready for the day they was doing angry noises around me and in a very rude way asked to leave the place, I do understand they’re doing their job to clean, and it would be okay if they had said me first thing to use another toilet as they would start the cleaning process in that one, but no, they said I could use and then just kicked me out when they wanted and I had to move to another toilet for finishing getting ready.
Positive Reviews:
The location was amazing, you can get anywhere from the hostel, there’s bus and metro almost at the door. 
It was surprisingly clean and the beds are comfortable enough. 

The one huge minus on the hostel is also the huge plus, because of it’s location it can be real loud, it was a lot of ambulances and police cars going around really noisy in some late hours witch might disturb those of light sleep.

Negative Reviews: No air-condition in the room was too hot
Positive Reviews: Location,breakfast

Review Title: Super friendly people in the hostel
Positive Reviews: The people in the reception are super friendly and supportive. Especially; Oleg, Mateo, Vyom, Szabi and Erika. They ameliorated my stay in the hostel. I felt at home every time. There is AC everywhere in the hostel. In my opinion, it’s the friendliest hostel in Budapest. I would strongly recommend you to stay in this hostel. Cheers to the staff and employees for making my stay more comfortable and enjoyable.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: My matress is terrible, one side is saggy, which is very uncomfortable. And it has no blind to cover the bed, has no private.
Positive Reviews: Staff is very friendly.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: There was only two WCs and two showers for more than 15 people. Is definitely not enough and you may spend 30 minutes until it's your turn.
Positive Reviews: The atmosphere in the common room.
Room Type: Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room with Standard Bunk Beds

Negative Reviews: The room had no a/c so was unbearably hot in the room for the majority of the time. We had to keep the window open, with the tram and the traffic just below. I did not get a lot of sleep. Going to a hostel around the corner.
Positive Reviews: Staff, people, general atmosphere. What's app group, the bar, water pressure in the shower.
